Job Description: Optics11Life is an international fast-growing high-tech company based in Amsterdam and is developing new optical fiber measurement systems for many different markets, with customers all over the world.Manufacturing of these high-tech and precision mechanical instruments is done in house and includes a wide range of techniques and skills, such as fine mechanical assembly, electronics assembly, adjustments, calibrations, programming and testing.We are looking for a pro-active and experienced Manufacturing Engineer who wants to be part of a young and enthusiastic team and wants to grow with the company.The ideal candidate:Has an MBO or BSc degree in electronics or related, or has relevant work experience in this direction;Had good skills in assembling, and adjusting fine mechanical components;Has very good SMD soldering skills;Has good understanding of electronic circuitry and components, and is able to read electronic schematics;Has experience with using measuring equipment (e.g. multimeter, oscilloscope, function generator);Is precise and can work in a structured way (including documentation)Has a good command of the English language in speech and writingExperience with optical fiber optic systems is a plusAre you:Willing to learn a lot in a short timeExcited to work in a constantly changing environmentNot easily frustrated when things are not going according to planYoung at heart and mindFulltime availableDo you think that you are a good match for Optics11? Let’s get in touch!Job Types: Full-time, ContractCOVID-19 considerations:We have taken precautions against the Corona virus such as an hallway divider, facemasks and sanitary hand gel, also the 1.5 meter distance can be assured.Work Remotely:No

Bioprocessing Operators (All Levels)


Wacker Biotech is the microbial CDMO - specialising in contract manufacturing of therapeutic proteins, vaccines and Live Microbial Products. Our services cover cell banking, process & analytical development and the GMP manufacturing of biologics for clinical & commercial supply.

With over 20 years of experience producing microbial derived proteins and vaccines, Wacker Biotech is a world-leading partner when it comes to manufacturing microbial biopharmaceuticals.

Wacker Biotech is supporting our customer to scale up the production of a Covid19 vaccine candidate - with an initial plan to produce 100 million doses. We need you to play your part in producing the vaccine!

We are hiring now across our Bioprocessing and Quality teams.


The Bioprocessing Operator is involved in preparation and execution of bulk drug substance of an mRNA based COVID-19 vaccine. In addition, you are closely working together with other Bioprocessing teams working on various pharmaceutical products (protein, polysaccharide and live microbial).

Your tasks:
Execution of preparative activities for GMP production such as buffer preparation, washing, build-up of sterile goodsExecution of routine activities on the complex systems within the departments Fermentation (USP), Purification (DSP)Perform all process activities in accordance with GMP guidelines.

Your profile:
At least an MBO/HBO level of education with relevant technical and process experienceQuality and safety-conscious, flexible and proactivePreferably experience in working under GMP guidelinesTeam player with a high degree of autonomyHigh priority on personal hygieneAnalytical, accurate and structuredWilling to work in shifts (from Monday to Friday)Good Dutch and English written and oral communicative skillsExperience in the (bio) pharmaceutical IndustryYou reside in and are eligible to work in The Netherlands (valid work permit).
Sustainability is one of WACKER's corporate goals - also as an employer. We want you to remain productive, healthy and successful long term. That is why we offer, for example, comprehensive health management and a variety of advanced training programs and courses for individual development opportunities, alongside a good work-life balance. Naturally, we also have a fair compensation system and above-average social benefits.


Discover more about this exciting opportunity here

For more details contact our recruitment partner Kelly Services:
Arvind Ramsaran - +31 6 22 53 75 38

INTERNSHIP DESCRIPTIONYou will be an intern but you will be treated like a full time employee developing skills in sales and marketing, If you are making good sales, you will receive commissions and a job offer at the end of your internship. If you need a visa sponsor, and you are good we will consider to be your sponsor.We are Maya Gold Trading, an organic trading company based in Amsterdam. Our core business is bulk organic ingredient trading & private label solutions. However, we are passionate about our brand Maya Gold Organic, we want to push the brand more. What does that mean? The daily bread of the firm is to import large quantities of sugar, seeds, oils from Asia and to sell them in large quantities (for cheap! And often with 30 days credit terms) to food manufacturers and traders in Europe. The butter of our business is the private label (contract manufacturing, white labelling) which means we receive an art file from a supermarket or brand and we will produce 5000 to 20000 units finished for retail with their brand. We produce they sell. We must continue to do this while also growing our own label Maya Gold Organic which has over 40 products in the range. Lately we launched a vegan chocolate spread similar to Nutella but healthier and tastier. We also recently launched an organic CBD oil with a fantastic profit margin.We are re-launching our web-shop www.mayagoldorganic and we soon will engage clients directly and will be able to post our products to their home. Our Instagram account will also get more attention on the future in line with our online strategy. You will help us to post and to engage clients.Our range of raw materials include organic all things coconut, agave, vegan proteins, superfoods, hemp, cacao, CBD and moreYou will be part of our international sales team and you will be pro-actively reaching out to companies in our targeted markets in Europe to discover their potential needs. you must first qualify the lead. Is this potential client worth it? Does it fit the bill? You shall lead score from our own data base, trade show directories, google and with your great product knowledge, quick and accurate administrative skills, and your proactive, customer oriented attitude, you know how to connect with customers, and how to make potential customers excited about our portfolio. successful in this role, and you will be an important moving peace in an already successful sales team, which you can learn from every day. Ideally, within 3-6 months, you will be ready to become an Account Manager and handle the full sales process yourself.Your Tasks: Contact targeted account lists in specific areas in Europe (maintain and build a good customer relationship, reply to customer questions, send updates about delivery times and stock status to back office)Managing everything concerning order processing (process incoming orders, ensure delivery of new product samples and sales material, etc.)Ensure correct logistics planning and correct invoicing of the delivered ordersReach out these targeted accounts pro-actively via phone, email and socialDocument everything in our * CRM BASEWorking hours run from 9am to 6pm with a 1 hr break in the middle of the dayWork is carried out in the office Hoogte Kadijk 143F1 unless you are working from home due to pandemic work seating placementThe requirements: HBO (higher professional education) mentalityPersistence in contacting and lead scoringLong Term mentality, you will see results but not as fast as anyone hopes, ce la vie.Strong mental attitude / strong analytical skills (can you see the whole and the relationship of each part to the other)Minimum of 2-3 years of relevant work experienceSales mindsetCustomer oriented with advanced communication skillsKnowledge of / experience with Exact online software is considered a plusGood verbal and written communication skills in both Dutch and English (other languages are also appreciated)Ability to communicate in a clear way, to work in a team and the desire to learnExperience in B2B cold callingStress resistantWe offer: -The salary is below normal for our firm due to the pandemic and we know this. The commission scheme has been raised to make up for that, we need results and we can pay better based on performance.A dynamic and challenging international work environment, at a young and fast-growing international entrepreneurial company, based in Amsterdam CentrumA base salary + generous commissions and the possibility for a bonus based on your performance23 vacation daysJob Types: Full-time, ContractSecondary benefits:Travel allowanceFriday afternoon drinksFlexible working hoursJob Types: Full-time, InternshipSalary: €600.00 per monthExperience:business school: 2 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Location:Amsterdam (Preferred)Language:english (Preferred)Work Remotely:No

As a global leader in (Tech) Consulting, Assurance, Tax and Transactions services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better.

Within (Tech) Consulting specialized consultants work in various disciplines; from developing until implementing a strategy within diverse company branches and different segments. Our multidisciplinary teams crossing cultural borders work at companies within the fields of Data Analytics, Technology, IT, Data Privacy, Cybersecurity, Strategy, Finance, Risk, Supply Chain & Operations and Life Science & Healthcare. We believe that by managing our clients’ challenges we can make a critical difference.

What you can expect – enriching experiences that will last a lifetime
EY’s Supply Chain & Operations (SC&O) practice supports clients across different domains: Supply Chain, Procurement, Operational Excellence (both in Manufacturing and Services Organizations) and Smart Factory. In this role as consultant your main focus will be Operational Excellence for Manufacturing. Additionally you have the flexibility to work in the other domains.
In our Operational Excellence for Manufacturing domain we help leading companies with optimizing their manufacturing operations processes. This ranges from organization-wide operating model re-design and restructuring, to plant, department and process improvements, as well as implementing digital transformation journeys for (shop floor) operations. We look at processes, systems, organization and performance management, while also taking behavior and leadership into account. Total Productive Management (TPM) and Lean principles and philosophy play an important role. Projects typically consist of an analysis and advice phase followed by the implementation of the recommendations.
As a consultant your role will be to lead a sub project within client engagements. You will work independently as well as in teams at our clients, supporting them with improving their business performance. You will work together with EY consultants to coach and support client team members from all levels of the organization, perform analyses and report findings and results.
Drawing on your knowledge, skills and experience, you will start to build valued relationships with external clients and internal peers. Moreover, you will also support in the development of project proposals and thought leadership.
You will play an active role within the team and contribute to the development of all team members.

What you can contribute – skills for shaping the future
Minimum 1 years of work experience in Consultancy and/or in Industry within the field of Operational Excellence, Lean Six Sigma, TPM, Production Management or Continuous Improvement within Manufacturing Organizations.
In addition, experience in/with one or more of the following areas is a plus: Maintenance, Warehousing, Quality, HSE
A Master's degree preferably in the field of Operations management or a technical/engineering discipline.
You have a passion for Operational Excellence in Manufacturing Excellence and experience and knowledge regarding project management. Lean Six Sigma Green Belt/Black Belt is an advantage.
Ideally, you have a basic understanding of manufacturing data & analytics (knowledge of data management architecture in manufacturing is a plus)
Fluent in English and Dutch. One (or more) of the following languages would be a preference: French, Spanish, Italian or Polish. Flexibility with working abroad.
Excellent analytical capabilities, strong communication, influencing and people skills, result-driven, the ability to be pragmatic in execution of projects and conceptual thinking.

What we are offering – an inspiring work environment
We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development. At EY, your competencies and your areas of interest will determine your future, plus we offer you:
Join in the steep learning curve and improve your skillset and earn management responsibilities.
Acknowledgement: Receive constructive support, coaching and feedback as a part of our Leadership & Development process on a regular base; feedback of counselors and planning of personal and professional development goals.
Become part of international projects through our global network and work along multicultural teams.

Find out more here about the many benefits to which you are entitled as employee at EY

Become part of our high-performing teams!
If you have any questions, please contact Liselotte Breitenstein via +31(0)6 21251438 or via email Liselotte.Breitenstein@nl.ey.com

An (online) assessment and a pre employment screening are part of the application procedure.
Due to laws and regulations, and because EY (and in some cases its clients) has high demands on the reliability and integrity of its employees, every new employee will be screened. Depending on your rank the pre employment screening could contain the following: Certificate of Conduct (in Dutch: VOG) or - if requesting a Dutch VOG is not possible - Criminal Background Check of the country you are currently living or have lived during the last five years, integrity questionnaire, verification of ID, diploma’s and/or work experience and consultation of the Dutch insolvency registry.
If you have any questions, please contact the recruiter as mentioned above.

SHEET - METAL PROGRAMMER - (FULLTIME)At ARKTURA , we make design happen. Creativity, expert knowledge, and cutting-edge technology shape everything we do - whether it's exploring new ways to unite form and function, adapting our pre-configured architectural systems to meet project needs, or partnering with clients through our Solutions Studio.Our multidisciplinary team brings together architects, designers, programmers, engineers, and artists with a deep understanding of the creative process. We use our collective ingenuity to bridge the gaps between design intent and manufacturing capabilities, and now, we're proud to announce that we are bridging the gap between the North America and Europe.Our growing firm is seeking a highly organized, proactive, and energetic candidate to join our team as Sheet - Metal Programmer. Our widely published company is headquartered in a state-of-the-art design and manufacturing facility in Amsterdam, where we specialize in manufacturing architectural systems. Our talented team consists of designers, engineers, architects, and software developers with a vast and exciting knowledge base.Sheet - Metal ProgrammerOur growing team is seeking an organized, and proactive candidate to fill the role of Sheet - Metal Programmer. Projects are constantly changing; quantities range from one off prototype's to short run production. You will be joining a fun, energetic, and motivated team.Responsibilities and DutiesMust possess some knowledge of architectural products, and systems or be prepared to learn them quickly.Must be able to think independently and problem solve day-to-day sales problems.Manage external vendors and fabricators for large volume orders and specialized part production.Ensure external vendors deliver parts according to Arktura specifications and quality control standards.Must be comfortable on the phone with suppliers, vendors, and fabricators.Production of programs for CNC mills, Press brakes, and Laser machines using CAD / CAM software.Assist and train CNC operators with setups, tool selection, and verify accuracy of machined components as needed.Generate tooling setup sheets and maintain records as required.Maintain CAD / CAM software, software, and filing system.Maintain standards for programming and design.A working knowledge of sheet-metal installation and fabrication processes (measuring, cutting, bending, forming, and drilling riveting).Safely operate shop equipment such as: brakes, presses, riveting equipment, shears, and hand tools associated with sheet-metal functions.Have thorough knowledge on proper hardware use for various sheet metal applications.Qualifications and Skills5+ years' experience in sheet metal fabrication and CNC programming.Experience with sheet metal fabrication such as: façade paneling, metal furniture, metal shelving, metal cabinets, or electronics boxes such as test cabinets or test equipment boxes.Experience around press brakes, laser cutters, CNC punches etc.Ability to train machine operators and fabricators on lasers, mills, brakes, presses, riveting equipment, shears, and hand tools associated with sheet metal production.Experience with the following programs (or similar): Trutops, Bysoft, Mastercam, Solidworks.Ability operate fabrication equipment: Drill presses, Shears, riveters etc.Attention to detail a must.Ability to read and interpret blueprints and engineering documentation.Ability to foresee potential machine issues prior to failure.Must speak Dutch (Natively) and English clearly and able to write legibly in both. Ability to speak another language is a plus.Must be able to provide, understand, and complete instructions furnished in written, oral or scheduled form.Maintain a cooperative working relationship with co-workers.Must have a sense of urgency and have a genuine commitment to producing high quality products and solutions with aerospace tolerances.To apply, please submit both a salary history and CV Submissions without both will not be reviewed.Type of employment: Fixed term, Indefinite termType of employment: Full-time, Fixed term, Indefinite termJob Types: Full-time, ContractCOVID-19 considerations:Measures against the coronavirus:We follow the recommendations of the RIVM.Experience:Sheet Metal: 1 year (Preferred)Language:English (Required)Dutch (Required)Work Remotely:No

Do you want to be part of a dynamic fast developing company, where you will be working on manufacturing high tech measurement systems for our Life Science department?About the company: Optics11 was founded in 2011 as a university spin-off. With a promising unique technology based on optical fiber sensing, a first product was built in 2012: an extremely sensitive measurement device that could break new ground in the field of tissue engineering and regenerative medicine. After this product, many more unique sensing products were developed and put in the market. The company now has two business units serving different markets with different products: Optics11 Life and Optics11 Industrial Sensing. Over the last years the company has grown rapidly and employs over 50 professionals, with an installed base of successful products all over the world.About the position: Your job will be the manufacture of our high-tech measurement systems. This will be partly done in house and will include (fine) mechanical and electronic assembly, software installation, and hardware, software and performance testing. Handling repairs and upgrades are also part of the job.You will be responsible for the quality of every system you wil build and test.As Optics11 Life is constantly developing both new and existing products, you will have to adapt by learning new skills and procedures.This is a job which requires a broad skill set and offer a challenging work environment.The ideal candidate: Has an MBO or BSc degree in electronics or related, or has relevant work experience in this direction;Has very good SMD soldering skills and can work with small mechanical parts;Has good understanding of electronic circuitry and is able to read electronic schematics;Has experience with measuring equipment (e.g. multimeter, oscilloscope, function generator);Is precise and can work in a structured way (including documentation);Has a good command of the English language in speech and writing;Experience with optical fiber optic systems is a plus.Are you: Willing to learn a lot in a short time;Excited to work in a constantly developing environment ;Not easily frustrated when things are not going according to plan;Fulltime available;Looking for a long-term commitment.What we offer: Competitive primary and secondary working conditions within a challenging and dynamic international organization with driven and passionate colleagues. Furthermore, there is an informal work environment and the opportunity to develop yourself.Do you think that you are a good match for Optics11 Life? Let’s get in touch!Please send in your resume and motivation letter to the email address posted on our website or apply via IndeedContractduur 12 maandenJob Type: ContractExperience:Manufacturing Engineering: 1 year (Preferred)Work Remotely:No

Job Title: Industry X Consultant - Digital Manufacturing & Operations
Job Description:
In Industry X we shape the future of making things, and the things we make.
Our Industry X Team drives innovation by delivering the best-in-class management consultancy based on industrial experience leveraged by the latest technologies. The future of making things, and the things we make. Evolution of industry practices have been witnessed with evolution of technology. We've been helping businesses adopt and implement the new for years; it is critical we apply this to manufacturers and products companies, service organizations and software companies, to fuel their next level of growth.
Digital Manufacturing & Operations helps clients replace existing manufacturing and supply chain methods with the ‘New’- digitally enabled multi-site plant optimization. From strategy, vision and ambition plans, to digitizing global plant networks and embedding cross factory operations at speed and at scale; our solutions help enable ever smaller lot size production, hyper personalization and lower total operating costs throughout the product life cycle. Our way of working is to collaborate across the industries and the services to reinvent clients’ products, services and platforms, to be smarter and more connected. Join us as we reinvent industries across Consumer Goods & Services and Retail Products, Industrial Equipment & Construction, Medical Tech Equipment, Media, High Tech, Aerospace and Defense, Chemicals, Oil and Gas, and Utilities.

Your Job
This is an exciting opportunity to join the Industry X group in the Netherlands with focus on Digital Manufacturing & Operations (DMO). We partner with our clients to build platform-based business and operating models, helping to navigate the shift to experience-driven innovation and accelerate time to revenue. We architect, design, develop, and build solutions, hardware and scalable business in this space. We help our clients transform their organizations to innovate and digitize businesses to optimize the return on investment to ensure long-term sustainability.

What are your responsibilities?
Lead your team in Manufacturing & Operations transformation programs to drive process & innovation activities at our clients
Be passionate to work on Industry X related technologies and drive client digital transformation journeys
Collaborate with technical architects and business teams to determine the details and value of proposed solutions
Collaborate with other key capabilities where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Supply Chain & Operations practices
Help your team pinpoint the right Industry X strategic approaches & points of view, capabilities (where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Supply Chain & Operations practices) and technologies to meet the needs of clients and help draw up practical transformation road maps that position clients for long-term success
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
You’re as good with people as you are with business processes and technology, a true team player with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Your team
Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background
University degree with a strong affinity for technology
3-5 years of relevant industry experience and digital transformations
Experienced in working with Digital Manufacturing concepts, Connected Manufacturing, IIoT, Connected Platforms, Edge & Cloud Analytics, Digital Twins, MES/MOM etc.
Familiar with system implementation methodologies such as Agile and Waterfall
Fluent in English, both spoken and written
Willingness to travel to (international) client sites (in compliance with up-to-date travel policies)

Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance
Discount on Accenture shares
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week

Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.
Questions? Connect with Iris Jansen through iris.jansen@accenture.com.

Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background
University degree with a strong affinity for technology
3-5 years of relevant industry experience and digital transformations
Experienced in working with Digital Manufacturing concepts, Connected Manufacturing, IIoT, Connected Platforms, Edge & Cloud Analytics, Digital Twins, MES/MOM etc.
Familiar with system implementation methodologies such as Agile and Waterfall
Fluent in English, both spoken and written
Willingness to travel to (international) client sites (in compliance with up-to-date travel policies)

Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance
Discount on Accenture shares
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week

Interested?

Job Title: Industry X Consultant - Digital Manufacturing & Operations
Job Description:
In Industry X we shape the future of making things, and the things we make.
Our Industry X Team drives innovation by delivering the best-in-class management consultancy based on industrial experience leveraged by the latest technologies. The future of making things, and the things we make. Evolution of industry practices have been witnessed with evolution of technology. We've been helping businesses adopt and implement the new for years; it is critical we apply this to manufacturers and products companies, service organizations and software companies, to fuel their next level of growth.
Digital Manufacturing & Operations helps clients replace existing manufacturing and supply chain methods with the ‘New’- digitally enabled multi-site plant optimization. From strategy, vision and ambition plans, to digitizing global plant networks and embedding cross factory operations at speed and at scale; our solutions help enable ever smaller lot size production, hyper personalization and lower total operating costs throughout the product life cycle. Our way of working is to collaborate across the industries and the services to reinvent clients’ products, services and platforms, to be smarter and more connected. Join us as we reinvent industries across Consumer Goods & Services and Retail Products, Industrial Equipment & Construction, Medical Tech Equipment, Media, High Tech, Aerospace and Defense, Chemicals, Oil and Gas, and Utilities.

Your Job
This is an exciting opportunity to join the Industry X group in the Netherlands with focus on Digital Manufacturing & Operations (DMO). We partner with our clients to build platform-based business and operating models, helping to navigate the shift to experience-driven innovation and accelerate time to revenue. We architect, design, develop, and build solutions, hardware and scalable business in this space. We help our clients transform their organizations to innovate and digitize businesses to optimize the return on investment to ensure long-term sustainability.

What are your responsibilities?
Lead your team in Manufacturing & Operations transformation programs to drive process & innovation activities at our clients
Be passionate to work on Industry X related technologies and drive client digital transformation journeys
Collaborate with technical architects and business teams to determine the details and value of proposed solutions
Collaborate with other key capabilities where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Supply Chain & Operations practices
Help your team pinpoint the right Industry X strategic approaches & points of view, capabilities (where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Supply Chain & Operations practices) and technologies to meet the needs of clients and help draw up practical transformation road maps that position clients for long-term success
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
You’re as good with people as you are with business processes and technology, a true team player with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Your team

Job Title: Industry X Consultant - Digital Manufacturing & Operations
Job Description:
In Industry X we shape the future of making things, and the things we make.
Our Industry X Team drives innovation by delivering the best-in-class management consultancy based on industrial experience leveraged by the latest technologies. The future of making things, and the things we make. Evolution of industry practices have been witnessed with evolution of technology. We've been helping businesses adopt and implement the new for years; it is critical we apply this to manufacturers and products companies, service organizations and software companies, to fuel their next level of growth.
Digital Manufacturing & Operations helps clients replace existing manufacturing and supply chain methods with the ‘New’- digitally enabled multi-site plant optimization. From strategy, vision and ambition plans, to digitizing global plant networks and embedding cross factory operations at speed and at scale; our solutions help enable ever smaller lot size production, hyper personalization and lower total operating costs throughout the product life cycle. Our way of working is to collaborate across the industries and the services to reinvent clients’ products, services and platforms, to be smarter and more connected. Join us as we reinvent industries across Consumer Goods & Services and Retail Products, Industrial Equipment & Construction, Medical Tech Equipment, Media, High Tech, Aerospace and Defense, Chemicals, Oil and Gas, and Utilities.

Your Job
This is an exciting opportunity to join the Industry X group in the Netherlands with focus on Digital Manufacturing & Operations (DMO). We partner with our clients to build platform-based business and operating models, helping to navigate the shift to experience-driven innovation and accelerate time to revenue. We architect, design, develop, and build solutions, hardware and scalable business in this space. We help our clients transform their organizations to innovate and digitize businesses to optimize the return on investment to ensure long-term sustainability.

What are your responsibilities?
Lead your team in Manufacturing & Operations transformation programs to drive process & innovation activities at our clients
Be passionate to work on Industry X related technologies and drive client digital transformation journeys
Collaborate with technical architects and business teams to determine the details and value of proposed solutions
Collaborate with other key capabilities where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Supply Chain & Operations practices
Help your team pinpoint the right Industry X strategic approaches & points of view, capabilities (where relevant such as Industry Groups, Applied Intelligence and Supply Chain & Operations practices) and technologies to meet the needs of clients and help draw up practical transformation road maps that position clients for long-term success
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
You’re as good with people as you are with business processes and technology, a true team player with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Your team
Our consultants in Strategy & Consulting are changing businesses every day using deep industry insights, knowledge and innovative ideas. Positioned at the crucial intersection of business, technology and industry, we devise creative new strategies based on trends, insights and data. With an eye for competitive advantage, digital disruption, operating models and the future workforce, we take on the challenge of designing and implementing transformative business solutions, using the newest technology.
Our research-based advice and situational analyses enable our clients to act with speed and confidence. Whether we're investigating complex issues or identifying new opportunities, our work always comes down to one thing: unlocking value and creating real, tangible impacts.

Your background
University degree with a strong affinity for technology
3-5 years of relevant industry experience and digital transformations
Experienced in working with Digital Manufacturing concepts, Connected Manufacturing, IIoT, Connected Platforms, Edge & Cloud Analytics, Digital Twins, MES/MOM etc.
Familiar with system implementation methodologies such as Agile and Waterfall
Fluent in English, both spoken and written
Willingness to travel to (international) client sites (in compliance with up-to-date travel policies)

Our offer
Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.
Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including:
A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card)
An expense allowance
Discount on Accenture shares
The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week

Interested?
Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.
Questions? Connect with Iris Jansen through iris.jansen@accenture.com.

About BeetronicsBeetronics designs high quality monitors and touchscreens for professional and industrial use. With a global presence, our display solutions can be found across many applications and industries, including manufacturing, maritime shipping, broadcasting, automotive, healthcare and more, as stand alone monitors or as integrated touchscreens. Typically, our clients find us online first and therefore our business can best be described as Ecommerce.Beetronics monitors are used by thousands of users everyday, all around the world. We are proud to have supplied many inspiring companies and organizations; from local IT integrators to multinationals in all corners of the globe.The RoleYou will be the primary point of contact of Beetronics for the French market. In this role you will be responsible for all incoming acquisition. This can vary from on demand tech support to leading sales cycles from lead to closure. Beyond consulting clients over the phone and email, you will be responsible for optimizing and maintaining the French website and the other French marketing channels. This can range from fine tuning the content, to SEA, SEO, blogs, improving the FAQ and developing use cases.We are growing fast and constantly work to improve our business. Therefore in down time, we need someone who can work independent and is highly motivated to improve the company. We provide the freedom, time and tools to come up with your own projects based on your own interests. In the past this has lead to marketing projects such as developing 3D renders and video content to strategic projects that impact our products and the way we work.Home OfficeYou can work mainly from home in this position following regular office hours. Our team is always online and we are in direct contact throughout the day via chat, phone, email, project management software and video-conferences.This position requires you to have a dedicated workspace. A place where you are able to work focused and without distractions during office hours. Beetronics will provide job-specific equipment such as a phone, PC, conference equipment, etc.PS. This position is not for someone who is looking to work remotely with his laptop from a coffee-house or kitchen-table.Your profileWe need someone with excellent written and verbal communication skills in French. The ideal candidate is tech savvy. The nature of our products require basic technical understanding about connectors, resolutions, aspect ratios and voltage ranges.Some key skills and experience we are looking for:· Excellent verbal and written communication in French.· A minimum of 2 years relevant commercial experience· Tech-savvy and highly digital· Able to accomplish tasks and projects highly independently· Experience in online marketing is a plus (Adwords, SEO, Analytics)Why you should applyBeetronics offers great benefits based on experience and offers you the opportunity to work from the comfort of your own home. Yet still you will be part of a long established company and work together with colleagues remotely. Within this role, there will be plenty of room for initiative and self-improvement. You will get a big chunk of responsibility and will be part of a young, fast-moving and ambitious team.Apply today!Eager to learn a lot on the job as well as having enough freedom to start your own projects? We are happy to receive your application. Please, do not forget to include a short letter of motivation.Benefits:Work from home opportunitiesMoney for vacationJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: €2,800.00 - €3,400.00 per monthExperience:Commercial: 2 years (Required)Language:French (Required)Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Beyond consulting clients over the phone and email, you will be responsible for optimizing and maintaining the French website and the other French marketing channels. This can range from fine tuning the content, to SEA, SEO, blogs, improving the FAQ and developing use cases.We are growing fast and constantly work to improve our business. Therefore in down time, we need someone who can work independent and is highly motivated to improve the company. We provide the freedom, time and tools to come up with your own projects based on your own interests. In the past this has lead to marketing projects such as developing 3D renders and video content to strategic projects that impact our products and the way we work.Home OfficeYou can work mainly from home in this position following regular office hours. Our team is always online and we are in direct contact throughout the day via chat, phone, email, project management software and video-conferences.This position requires you to have a dedicated workspace. A place where you are able to work focused and without distractions during office hours. Beetronics will provide job-specific equipment such as a phone, PC, conference equipment, etc.PS. This position is not for someone who is looking to work remotely with his laptop from a coffee-house or kitchen-table.Your profileWe need someone with excellent written and verbal communication skills in French. The ideal candidate is tech savvy. The nature of our products require basic technical understanding about connectors, resolutions, aspect ratios and voltage ranges.Some key skills and experience we are looking for:· Excellent verbal and written communication in French.· A minimum of 2 years relevant commercial experience· Tech-savvy and highly digital· Able to accomplish tasks and projects highly independently· Experience in online marketing is a plus (Adwords, SEO, Analytics)Why you should applyBeetronics offers great benefits based on experience and offers you the opportunity to work from the comfort of your own home. Yet still you will be part of a long established company and work together with colleagues remotely. Within this role, there will be plenty of room for initiative and self-improvement. You will get a big chunk of responsibility and will be part of a young, fast-moving and ambitious team.Apply today!Eager to learn a lot on the job as well as having enough freedom to start your own projects? We are happy to receive your application. Please, do not forget to include a short letter of motivation.Benefits:Work from home opportunitiesMoney for vacationJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: €2,800.00 - €3,400.00 per monthExperience:Commercial: 2 years (Required)Language:French (Required)Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview process

Major Responsibilities
Pick products from multiple areas in a quick efficient manner.
Follow the principles of one piece flow and support team members to minimise picking and packing times within warehouse area.
Picking and processing orders to a high quality standard as in accurate and precise, required by the nature of our business and all in line with procedures and time lines.
Use of software to prepare and processes orders for dispatch in a high volume, high quality environment.
Working to a high standard following quality procedures
Receipt incoming stock from the Production area to provide same day delivery and able to place stock away into cold rooms
Keep warehouse and cold room area to highest quality standard.
Provide administrative support
Responsible for invoicing

Required Skills/Experience
Experience working in high output distribution area is desirable.
Proven track record of working within a distribution/ manufacturing regulated industry is preferred.

Competencies
Working very accurately.
Good written and oral communication skills in Dutch and English.
Excellent organisational skills.
Computer literate.
Attention to detail.
Able to start new initiatives
Able to work independently
Able to work with deadlines
Able to work punctual under stress

Education
Minimum MBO level

Location:
This role shall be based at LBS Amsterdam

Reporting to:
This role reports to the Customer Support Manager

Working to a high standard following quality procedures
Receipt incoming stock from the Production area to provide same day delivery and able to place stock away into cold rooms
Keep warehouse and cold room area to highest quality standard.
Provide administrative support
Responsible for invoicing

Required Skills/Experience
Experience working in high output distribution area is desirable.
Proven track record of working within a distribution/ manufacturing regulated industry is preferred.

Competencies
Working very accurately.
Good written and oral communication skills in Dutch and English.
Excellent organisational skills.
Computer literate.
Attention to detail.
Able to start new initiatives
Able to work independently
Able to work with deadlines
Able to work punctual under stress

Education
Minimum MBO level

This role reports to the Customer Support Manager

In support of developing our innovative NK cell therapies, we are looking for Quality Assurance Director based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
At Kiadis, we are leveraging the natural strengths of humanity and our collective immune systems to source the best cells for life. Our NK cell (natural killer cell) research and development programs and partnerships are at the cutting-edge of the industry, paving the way for new and exciting therapies, in immuno-oncology and beyond.
Are you ready to build a great quality system for our in-house manufacturing facility in order to delivers our amazing work to patients worldwide? Do you have strong knowledge of GMP and worked on site set-up o expansions before? Are you a strong communicator, charismatic influencer and able to effectively manage leadership encounters with a high sense of integrity? Read on.

The role
As the QA Director, you will be responsible for the coordination of all quality operations at the Amsterdam location including outsourced and in-house manufacturing. Your main focus is to ensure that the production and quality control activities are performed in compliance with cGMP/GDP requirements, in order for us to deliver the best quality product to patients. In your day-to-day you will:
Building cross functional relationships to support Quality Operations throughout Kiadis organization and at outsourced manufacturing and/or testing laboratories.
Ensuring the production and control activities performed at Kiadis manufacturing and testing locations are in compliance with GMP requirements.
Manage the QA Ops resource scheduling to ensure sufficient support to on-going manufacturing and testing.
Host regulatory inspections at Kiadis/CMO manufacturing and testing locations.
Perform audits of the Kiadis suppliers and service providers as required.
Provide guidance and support to Kiadis manufacturing and testing staff concerning compliance with relevant quality and regulatory policies and the development of strategies to improve quality working practices and systems.
Daily management of Kiadis quality operations, to include executed manufacturing record and data review, investigation support and regulatory inspection support as it relates to Kiadis products.
Supporting International Regulatory Inspections- managing preparation and any follow-up actions
Oversight of Kiadis manufacturing and QC release testing laboratories operations.

Quality Assurance
Our Quality Assurance department works with a strong motivation to deliver safe and effective personalized medicine to our patients. Our team of highly-skilled professionals ensure compliance on many levels, they also train our employees, which has resulted in quality being a key component of our company culture. As part of the Quality Assurance team, you will work with a high sense of urgency, work to continuously improve our processes and collaborate with different people from all over the world. Join us and see for yourself how you can make an impact.

The ideal candidate
We are looking for someone that has a strong background in Quality Assurance, experience with investigations and that likes being part of a dynamic organization. Our ideal candidate meets the following requirements:
HBO/University degree in biomedical and/or life sciences
Minimum of 8 years of Pharmaceutical/biotechnology experience.
In depth experience with Quality Systems and Quality Management programs, with an emphasis on Quality Control and Analytical Method Validation.
In depth knowledge of EU & FDA regulatory agencies expectations
A detailed and complete knowledge of international cGMP.
In-depth knowledge of international regulation inspections
Maintain expert knowledge with current international pharmaceutical/biotechnology industry trends
Proficient computer skills
Previous managerial experience Is mandatory.
Fluency in English, other languages are a plus.

What we offer
People from all over the world, together as one team, contribute to improving the lives of patients every day. We offer an exciting position in an innovative, dynamic and inspiring environment where you'll receive a competitive remuneration package, autonomy and the opportunity to make your own mark within the organization.
We create an environment where ideas are shared, experiences are impactful, and talent is developed. Because of our inclusive and family-like environment, you will always have the feeling of belonging & appreciation.

In support of developing our innovative NK cell therapies, we are looking for Quality Assurance Director based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
At Kiadis, we are leveraging the natural strengths of humanity and our collective immune systems to source the best cells for life. Our NK cell (natural killer cell) research and development programs and partnerships are at the cutting-edge of the industry, paving the way for new and exciting therapies, in immuno-oncology and beyond.
Are you ready to build a great quality system for our in-house manufacturing facility in order to delivers our amazing work to patients worldwide? Do you have strong knowledge of GMP and worked on site set-up o expansions before? Are you a strong communicator, charismatic influencer and able to effectively manage leadership encounters with a high sense of integrity? Read on.

The role
As the QA Director, you will be responsible for the coordination of all quality operations at the Amsterdam location including outsourced and in-house manufacturing. Your main focus is to ensure that the production and quality control activities are performed in compliance with cGMP/GDP requirements, in order for us to deliver the best quality product to patients. In your day-to-day you will:
Building cross functional relationships to support Quality Operations throughout Kiadis organization and at outsourced manufacturing and/or testing laboratories.
Ensuring the production and control activities performed at Kiadis manufacturing and testing locations are in compliance with GMP requirements.
Manage the QA Ops resource scheduling to ensure sufficient support to on-going manufacturing and testing.
Host regulatory inspections at Kiadis/CMO manufacturing and testing locations.
Perform audits of the Kiadis suppliers and service providers as required.
Provide guidance and support to Kiadis manufacturing and testing staff concerning compliance with relevant quality and regulatory policies and the development of strategies to improve quality working practices and systems.
Daily management of Kiadis quality operations, to include executed manufacturing record and data review, investigation support and regulatory inspection support as it relates to Kiadis products.
Supporting International Regulatory Inspections- managing preparation and any follow-up actions
Oversight of Kiadis manufacturing and QC release testing laboratories operations.

Our Quality Assurance department works with a strong motivation to deliver safe and effective personalized medicine to our patients. As part of the Quality Assurance team, you will work with a high sense of urgency, work to continuously improve our processes and collaborate with different people from all over the world. Join us and see for yourself how you can make an impact.

Working at Bitfury:

Bitfury is a leading emerging technologies company. At Bitfury, you can build the solutions of the future, with the most significant technologies of the millennium, in a modern and flexible workplace. We work a bit faster, and a bit smarter, so we can make the world a bit better.

Benefits of Working at Bitfury:

International Experiences & Global Impacts

Bitfury is an international company with 200+ team members in more than 16 countries. No matter your assignment, your work will support global technology initiatives and best-in-class security operations in North America, Asia and Europe, as well as help us fulfil our mission to make the world more trusted and secure.

Building the Future

We believe big data, artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, tokenized economies and cryptocurrencies are the future of our digital, global economy. Bitfury is building this future through our products that offer digitised security, asset management, government services and more. We consider ourselves first and foremost a technology company. We are a diversified organisation, with operations across multiple facets of the AI, blockchain, and digital currency sectors. If you are passionate about emerging technologies, you can build your future at Bitfury.

Accelerate Your Career

Bitfury is growing fast and looking for the next generation of leaders and entrepreneurs to help us. At Bitfury, you will be expected to create the future – not just execute it. If you are a self-starter, driven and collaborative team member, you can create a dynamic future for yourself and your career at Bitfury.

Modern Workplace with Intelligent Flexibility

Bitfury lets you work in the way you need to work to make your work faster, smarter and better. We will give you the resources you need to succeed – competitive pay and benefits, educational support, intellectual challenges, professional advancement, personal accommodations including remote work, and more. We pride ourselves on being less bureaucratic and a lot more impactful.

Start-up Culture with Established Results

Working with the world's leading experts and engineers, you will have the opportunity at Bitfury to pursue results that will power your success as well as lead to the adoption of game-changing technologies. Our teams work every day to make the impossible possible, to change the game, to be agile and effective, and most of all – to empower the rest of the world to do the same.

Personal and Professional Characteristics

We at Bitfury ensure our team members possess the ability to think out of the box and make the impossible possible. We are self-motivated and result-oriented, and we have an "owner of the company" mindset. We are constantly self-educating and developing. We are able to work in a team and collaborate. We have a "do good" mindset and are not afraid to dream big. And of course, we always deliver in time what we promised and with extreme attention to detail — because if we are not able to do the little things right, we will never be able to do big things right.

-

In this role you will be introduced to all aspects of Supply Chain Management and may be involved in Purchasing, Logistics, Manufacturing, and general administrative tasks for the Dutch Bitfury entities. We expect you to be interested in a career within Supply Chain, this role can be a pivot for more senior roles.

We do not expect you to have years of Supply Chain experience, you can learn that. What we do value is a hands-on mentality, being IT-savvy especially with Excel & Outlook and being able to operate in hectic situations.


Duties and responsibilities:

Support Purchasing:
Create purchase orders in our ERP system and follow up on approvals and payment statuses.
Liaise with suppliers for upcoming shipments.
Support the Logistics function:
Gather quotes and compare pricing for upcoming shipments.
Organize pick-up and delivery to our sites and customers.
Issue shipment Invoices for customs purposes.
Responsible for Inter-company administration.
Maintain an accurate administration online for all Incoming and Outgoing shipments.
Maintain an audit trail for all Incoming and Outgoing shipments, three-way match principle.
Ensure stakeholders provide the required documentation with regards to the above.

Qualification:

Bachelor's degree Supply Chain, Logistics or Engineering.
Some experience working In an International organization.
Speaks fluent English, Dutch and Russian is preferred.
Advanced MS Excel knowledge VBA Is preferred.
Has an experience with MS Access and Is keen to expand their working knowledge.
Some experience with NetSuite Is preferred.
Is a stress resilient personality and is adaptive enough to cope with ever changing targets and objectives.

We do not expect you to have years of Supply Chain experience, you can learn that. What we do value is a hands-on mentality, being IT-savvy especially with Excel & Outlook and being able to operate in hectic situations.


Duties and responsibilities:

Support Purchasing:
Create purchase orders in our ERP system and follow up on approvals and payment statuses.
Liaise with suppliers for upcoming shipments.
Support the Logistics function:
Gather quotes and compare pricing for upcoming shipments.
Organize pick-up and delivery to our sites and customers.
Issue shipment Invoices for customs purposes.
Responsible for Inter-company administration.
Maintain an accurate administration online for all Incoming and Outgoing shipments.
Maintain an audit trail for all Incoming and Outgoing shipments, three-way match principle.
Ensure stakeholders provide the required documentation with regards to the above.

Qualification:

Bachelor's degree Supply Chain, Logistics or Engineering.
Some experience working In an International organization.
Speaks fluent English, Dutch and Russian is preferred.
Advanced MS Excel knowledge VBA Is preferred.
Has an experience with MS Access and Is keen to expand their working knowledge.
Some experience with NetSuite Is preferred.
Is a stress resilient personality and is adaptive enough to cope with ever changing targets and objectives.

Working at Bitfury:

Bitfury is a leading emerging technologies company. At Bitfury, you can build the solutions of the future, with the most significant technologies of the millennium, in a modern and flexible workplace. We work a bit faster, and a bit smarter, so we can make the world a bit better.

Benefits of Working at Bitfury:

International Experiences & Global Impacts

Bitfury is an international company with 200+ team members in more than 16 countries. No matter your assignment, your work will support global technology initiatives and best-in-class security operations in North America, Asia and Europe, as well as help us fulfil our mission to make the world more trusted and secure.

Building the Future

We believe big data, artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, tokenized economies and cryptocurrencies are the future of our digital, global economy. Bitfury is building this future through our products that offer digitised security, asset management, government services and more. We consider ourselves first and foremost a technology company. We are a diversified organisation, with operations across multiple facets of the AI, blockchain, and digital currency sectors. If you are passionate about emerging technologies, you can build your future at Bitfury.

Accelerate Your Career

Bitfury is growing fast and looking for the next generation of leaders and entrepreneurs to help us. At Bitfury, you will be expected to create the future – not just execute it. If you are a self-starter, driven and collaborative team member, you can create a dynamic future for yourself and your career at Bitfury.

Modern Workplace with Intelligent Flexibility

Bitfury lets you work in the way you need to work to make your work faster, smarter and better. We will give you the resources you need to succeed – competitive pay and benefits, educational support, intellectual challenges, professional advancement, personal accommodations including remote work, and more. We pride ourselves on being less bureaucratic and a lot more impactful.

Start-up Culture with Established Results

Working with the world's leading experts and engineers, you will have the opportunity at Bitfury to pursue results that will power your success as well as lead to the adoption of game-changing technologies. Our teams work every day to make the impossible possible, to change the game, to be agile and effective, and most of all – to empower the rest of the world to do the same.

Personal and Professional Characteristics

We at Bitfury ensure our team members possess the ability to think out of the box and make the impossible possible. We are self-motivated and result-oriented, and we have an "owner of the company" mindset. We are constantly self-educating and developing. We are able to work in a team and collaborate. We have a "do good" mindset and are not afraid to dream big. And of course, we always deliver in time what we promised and with extreme attention to detail — because if we are not able to do the little things right, we will never be able to do big things right.

We will give you the resources you need to succeed – competitive pay and benefits, educational support, intellectual challenges, professional advancement, personal accommodations including remote work, and more. We pride ourselves on being less bureaucratic and a lot more impactful.

Start-up Culture with Established Results

Working with the world's leading experts and engineers, you will have the opportunity at Bitfury to pursue results that will power your success as well as lead to the adoption of game-changing technologies. Our teams work every day to make the impossible possible, to change the game, to be agile and effective, and most of all – to empower the rest of the world to do the same.

Personal and Professional Characteristics

We at Bitfury ensure our team members possess the ability to think out of the box and make the impossible possible. We are self-motivated and result-oriented, and we have an "owner of the company" mindset. We are constantly self-educating and developing. We are able to work in a team and collaborate. We have a "do good" mindset and are not afraid to dream big. And of course, we always deliver in time what we promised and with extreme attention to detail — because if we are not able to do the little things right, we will never be able to do big things right.

-

In this role you will be introduced to all aspects of Supply Chain Management and may be involved in Purchasing, Logistics, Manufacturing, and general administrative tasks for the Dutch Bitfury entities. We expect you to be interested in a career within Supply Chain, this role can be a pivot for more senior roles.

We do not expect you to have years of Supply Chain experience, you can learn that. What we do value is a hands-on mentality, being IT-savvy especially with Excel & Outlook and being able to operate in hectic situations.


Duties and responsibilities:

Support Purchasing:
Create purchase orders in our ERP system and follow up on approvals and payment statuses.
Liaise with suppliers for upcoming shipments.
Support the Logistics function:
Gather quotes and compare pricing for upcoming shipments.
Organize pick-up and delivery to our sites and customers.
Issue shipment Invoices for customs purposes.
Responsible for Inter-company administration.
Maintain an accurate administration online for all Incoming and Outgoing shipments.
Maintain an audit trail for all Incoming and Outgoing shipments, three-way match principle.
Ensure stakeholders provide the required documentation with regards to the above.

Qualification:

Bachelor's degree Supply Chain, Logistics or Engineering.
Some experience working In an International organization.
Speaks fluent English, Dutch and Russian is preferred.
Advanced MS Excel knowledge VBA Is preferred.
Has an experience with MS Access and Is keen to expand their working knowledge.
Some experience with NetSuite Is preferred.
Is a stress resilient personality and is adaptive enough to cope with ever changing targets and objectives.

Working at Bitfury:

Bitfury is a leading emerging technologies company. At Bitfury, you can build the solutions of the future, with the most significant technologies of the millennium, in a modern and flexible workplace. We work a bit faster, and a bit smarter, so we can make the world a bit better.

Benefits of Working at Bitfury:

International Experiences & Global Impacts

Bitfury is an international company with 200+ team members in more than 16 countries. No matter your assignment, your work will support global technology initiatives and best-in-class security operations in North America, Asia and Europe, as well as help us fulfil our mission to make the world more trusted and secure.

Building the Future

We believe big data, artificial intelligence, blockchain technology, tokenized economies and cryptocurrencies are the future of our digital, global economy. Bitfury is building this future through our products that offer digitised security, asset management, government services and more. We consider ourselves first and foremost a technology company. We are a diversified organisation, with operations across multiple facets of the AI, blockchain, and digital currency sectors. If you are passionate about emerging technologies, you can build your future at Bitfury.

Job description
Manufacturing business based in Amsterdam is looking for an Internal Audit Manager for their growing team. A Big 4 trained auditor is therefore required to travel 20-40% of the time domestically and internationally within this acquisitive business.

The company is a successful European multinational, with over a billion euros in revenues. It has grown significantly through having a unique product and business model. The investment in internal audit is reflected in this growth; as the business adapts to the expansion and success it is experiencing, internal audit has become a key focus for the CEO.

Travelling globally, but for relatively short trips, you will be exposed to a highly international environment. Languages are not required except for the ability to speak excellent English. You will be improving processes within the operations of the business; finance, supply chain, production, sales, HR and a variety of other functions.

A Big 4 trained auditor is required; ideally with experience in an internal audit function. The grounding in finance plus the exposure to business processes is ideal. Candidates will be considered as long as they are willing to be based in Amsterdam, will travel, are willing to learn and see a positive challenge in joining a growing business. Please apply.

The company is a successful European multinational, with over a billion euros in revenues. It has grown significantly through having a unique product and business model. The investment in internal audit is reflected in this growth; as the business adapts to the expansion and success it is experiencing, internal audit has become a key focus for the CEO.

Travelling globally, but for relatively short trips, you will be exposed to a highly international environment. Languages are not required except for the ability to speak excellent English. You will be improving processes within the operations of the business; finance, supply chain, production, sales, HR and a variety of other functions.

A Big 4 trained auditor is required; ideally with experience in an internal audit function. The grounding in finance plus the exposure to business processes is ideal. Candidates will be considered as long as they are willing to be based in Amsterdam, will travel, are willing to learn and see a positive challenge in joining a growing business. Please apply.

Are you a highly collaborative and process oriented professional with an understanding of shop fittings production business and passion for store design? If yes, this could be your dream move.

ECCO is a leading company in the footwear industry with the reputation of a global manufacturer of high-quality, comfortable, state-of-the-art footwear. ECCO’s innovative approach, which can be found throughout the value chain, from hide to high street, combined with the aim of being excellent in everything they do, is what makes ECCO stand out as a company.
JOB PROFILE:

The Store Production Specialist will join the Global Creative Brand Experience team, working in close collaboration with store concept design and implementation on global production roll outs.

In this role, you will be responsible for contributing and maintaining the global portfolio of ECCO manufacturing partners. You will be the primary contact and you will ensure high standards are maintained throughout production according to ECCO requirements in terms of sustainability, quality, timing and budget.

You bring an innovative mindset and consistently build a value pipeline by leveraging relationships with stakeholders and suppliers to identify and drive value.

General Tasks

Monitoring, evaluating and reporting costs related to ECCO shop fittings
Maintaining and evaluating relationships with current global suppliers of ECCO shop fittings by regular follow-ups related to quality, costs and work capacity
Ensuring detailed ECCO concept’s technical documentation for quality and conformance
Taking part in development of concept elements and prototypes
Onboarding of new suppliers
Ensuring continuous improvements in shop fittings production by value engineering, price negotiation, logistic optimisation and shortening project lead time
Direct contact for markets and approval for locally supplied elements

Requirements

Bachelor degree or equivalent (engineering profile preferred) but the work experience is the primary qualification
Knowledge of architectural software (SketchUp / AutoCad)
Minimum of two year experience in a similar global role within retail or in shop fittings industry
Experience in project management
Proficient MS Office skills (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
A willingness and ability to travel (20 - 30 days per year) – meeting suppliers, snagging visits (only for special attention projects)
Understanding of retail operations
Good negotiation skills with international and multicultural mind set
Good understanding of technical drawings, shop fittings construction, materials and the application in the retail interior environment,
Ability to move among several projects simultaneously with the sense of urgency, understanding priorities and hands-on approach
Strong team player with excellent communication skills, open minded and with a good flair to communicate effectively on all levels and across borders
Highly detail oriented
Possession of Dutch working entitlements is required. Please note that his role does not provide relocation assistance.

What we offer

We pride ourselves on our craftmanship and the quality of the shoes we make for our customers. The typical ECCO employee is always curious, never quite satisfied with the status quo and strives for excellence and superior quality in every single product. We improve constantly by pushing forward with new techniques. No matter where you work at ECCO, you are a part of making products of which you can be proud.

Imagining yourself at ECCO? Get a glimpse of what your new exciting career entails on www.enter.ecco.com.

CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW
At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 25,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.

Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code – our shoe code is slightly stricter.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning – the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you’re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you’ll fit right in.

Ensuring continuous improvements in shop fittings production by value engineering, price negotiation, logistic optimisation and shortening project lead time
Direct contact for markets and approval for locally supplied elements

Requirements

Bachelor degree or equivalent (engineering profile preferred) but the work experience is the primary qualification
Knowledge of architectural software (SketchUp / AutoCad)
Minimum of two year experience in a similar global role within retail or in shop fittings industry
Experience in project management
Proficient MS Office skills (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
A willingness and ability to travel (20 - 30 days per year) – meeting suppliers, snagging visits (only for special attention projects)
Understanding of retail operations
Good negotiation skills with international and multicultural mind set
Good understanding of technical drawings, shop fittings construction, materials and the application in the retail interior environment,
Ability to move among several projects simultaneously with the sense of urgency, understanding priorities and hands-on approach
Strong team player with excellent communication skills, open minded and with a good flair to communicate effectively on all levels and across borders
Highly detail oriented
Possession of Dutch working entitlements is required. Please note that his role does not provide relocation assistance.
