Job Description
Fluor B.V. is part of Fluor Corporation based in the U.S., a professional and technical solutions provider focusing on Engineering, Procurement, Construction & Maintenance (EPCM) with more than 45.000 employees worldwide. Fluor offers Project Management and EPCM support in all phases of the project life-cycle based on the following business groups:
Energy Solutions
This group focuses on energy transition, chemicals, LNG and traditional oil and gas markets. Fluor pursues new opportunities emerging in the energy transition markets including carbon capture, green chemicals, hydrogen, biofuels and other low carbon energy sources. At the same time, Fluor continues to be an engineering and construction leader in the oil, gas and petrochemical industries.
Urban Solutions
Urbanization continues to drive demand and create significant growth opportunities for innovative and sustainable solutions in mining, metals, advanced technologies, manufacturing, life sciences, infrastructure and professional staffing.
Mission Solutions
As a leading provider of mission solutions, Fluor primarily focuses on federal agencies across the U.S. government and select international opportunities. These include, among others, the Department of Energy, the Department of Defense, the Federal Emergency Management Agency and intelligence agencies.

Fluor B.V. is based in Hoofddorp and is specialized in:
Energy transition, chemicals, LNG and traditional oil and gas markets (Energy Solutions) by managing challenging carbon capture, biofuels, renewables and petrochemical projectsAdvanced technologies, manufacturing, life sciences, infrastructure (Urban Solutions) by managing challenging data center, smart batteries, advanced materials, food & beverage, pharma and infrastructure projects
Fluor B.V. manages projects predominantly in Europe, the Middle East and Africa and has a workforce of about 500 employees from over 30 different nationalities with an office culture based on core values inclusive, honest, caring and inspiring

For our Project controls team we are looking for an experienced Planner with sufficient and proven knowledge of construction phases of projects.


Is this you ?

Logic and structure are your key fortes, enabling you to prepare and control all different levels project schedules.

From the overall Project Master Schedules initially developed in the proposal phase up to the detailed activity schedules at discipline level.
You are fully conversant with P6 and have a good understanding of all the engineering, procurement and construction work processes and their interfaces.

You know what is required to developed reliable project schedules and possess strong communication skills that enable you to interface with project leads in obtaining the required information.


You participate in interactive schedule sessions, and are hands-on with Excel and Access.

You are experienced with schedule analysis, progress measurement & reporting and analyzing risks, helping to develop mitigation strategies and assessing the schedule certainty.
To be Considered Candidates:
Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located and be able to interview on site., Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located.
Basic Job Requirements
Technical Bachelor degreeExperience in downstream of the energy & chemicals industry and preferred experience in Advanced Technology & Life Science which includes construction site assignment.
Advanced knowledge of Primavera , MS Office and AccessFluent in English and Dutch verbal and written is a must and preferably GermanOpen to work remotely
Other Job Requirements
Willing to travel and be assigned on project sitesCurrently living in the Netherlands
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in Advanced Technology & Life Science projects
Degree Required
Yes
Requisition Number
127126BR
Diverse Workforce
We reserve the right to modify or revise the job descriptions in part or in its entirety. Reasonable accommodations will be made in accordance with governing law.
We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by federal, state or local law.

Job Description
Fluor B.V. is part of Fluor Corporation based in the U.S., a professional and technical solutions provider focusing on Engineering, Procurement, Construction & Maintenance (EPCM) with more than 45.000 employees worldwide. Fluor offers Project Management and EPCM support in all phases of the project life-cycle based on the following business groups:
Energy Solutions
This group focuses on energy transition, chemicals, LNG and traditional oil and gas markets. Fluor pursues new opportunities emerging in the energy transition markets including carbon capture, green chemicals, hydrogen, biofuels and other low carbon energy sources. At the same time, Fluor continues to be an engineering and construction leader in the oil, gas and petrochemical industries.
Urban Solutions
Urbanization continues to drive demand and create significant growth opportunities for innovative and sustainable solutions in mining, metals, advanced technologies, manufacturing, life sciences, infrastructure and professional staffing.
Mission Solutions
As a leading provider of mission solutions, Fluor primarily focuses on federal agencies across the U.S. government and select international opportunities. These include, among others, the Department of Energy, the Department of Defense, the Federal Emergency Management Agency and intelligence agencies.

Fluor B.V. is based in Hoofddorp and is specialized in:
Energy transition, chemicals, LNG and traditional oil and gas markets (Energy Solutions) by managing challenging carbon capture, biofuels, renewables and petrochemical projectsAdvanced technologies, manufacturing, life sciences, infrastructure (Urban Solutions) by managing challenging data center, smart batteries, advanced materials, food & beverage, pharma and infrastructure projects
Fluor B.V. manages projects predominantly in Europe, the Middle East and Africa and has a workforce of about 500 employees from over 30 different nationalities with an office culture based on core values inclusive, honest, caring and inspiring

For our Project controls team we are looking for an experienced Planner with sufficient and proven knowledge of construction phases of projects.


Is this you ?

Logic and structure are your key fortes, enabling you to prepare and control all different levels project schedules.

From the overall Project Master Schedules initially developed in the proposal phase up to the detailed activity schedules at discipline level.
You are fully conversant with P6 and have a good understanding of all the engineering, procurement and construction work processes and their interfaces.

You know what is required to developed reliable project schedules and possess strong communication skills that enable you to interface with project leads in obtaining the required information.


You participate in interactive schedule sessions, and are hands-on with Excel and Access.

You are experienced with schedule analysis, progress measurement & reporting and analyzing risks, helping to develop mitigation strategies and assessing the schedule certainty.
To be Considered Candidates:
Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located and be able to interview on site., Must be authorized to work in the country where the position is located.
Basic Job Requirements
Technical Bachelor degreeExperience in downstream of the energy & chemicals industry and preferred experience in Advanced Technology & Life Science which includes construction site assignment.
Advanced knowledge of Primavera , MS Office and AccessFluent in English and Dutch verbal and written is a must and preferably GermanOpen to work remotely
Other Job Requirements
Willing to travel and be assigned on project sitesCurrently living in the Netherlands
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in Advanced Technology & Life Science projects
Degree Required
Yes

Supervisor COVID-19 vaccine production

Wacker Biotech is the microbial CDMO - specialising in contract manufacturing of therapeutic proteins, vaccines and Live Microbial Products. Our services cover cell banking, process & analytical development and the GMP manufacturing of biologics for clinical & commercial supply.

With over 20 years of experience producing microbial derived proteins and vaccines, Wacker Biotech is a world-leading partner when it comes to manufacturing microbial biopharmaceuticals.

Wacker Biotech is supporting our customer to scale up the production of a Covid19 vaccine candidate - with an initial plan to produce 100 million doses. We need you to play your part in producing the vaccine!

We are hiring now across our Bioprocessing and Quality teams.


The Supervisor (Covid19 vaccine production) is involved in the supervision, preparation and execution of bulk drug substance of various pharmaceutical products (protein, polysaccharide, live microbial, mRNA).

Your tasks:
Supervision of operators within shift, including appraisals and individual performance mentoringPrepare detailed production schedule and managing execution within a timely mannerAlign shift tasks with supervisor team and managerResponsible for appropriate training status within shift
Responsible for GMP compliance and Safety compliance within shift
Execution of preparative activities for GMP production and GMP production itselfYou are a Subject Matter Expert (SME) with respect to production facility and its equipment and directly involved in maintenance, validation and calibration.

Your profile:
At least an MBO/HBO level of education with relevant technical or biological production experienceQuality and safety-conscious, flexible and proactiveExperience in working under GMP guidelinesTeam player with a high degree of autonomy
Leadership skills on supervisor levelHigh priority on personal hygieneAnalytical, accurate and structured and flexibleWilling to work in shifts (three shifts from Monday to Friday)Good Dutch and English written and oral communicative skillsExperience in the (bio) pharmaceutical IndustryYou reside in and are eligible to work in The Netherlands (valid work permit).
Sustainability is one of WACKER's corporate goals - also as an employer. We want you to remain productive, healthy and successful long term. That is why we offer, for example, comprehensive health management and a variety of advanced training programs and courses for individual development opportunities, alongside a good work-life balance. Naturally, we also have a fair compensation system and above-average social benefits.


Discover more about this exciting opportunity here

For more details contact our recruitment partner Kelly Services:

Wacker Biotech is the microbial CDMO - specialising in contract manufacturing of therapeutic proteins, vaccines and Live Microbial Products. Our services cover cell banking, process & analytical development and the GMP manufacturing of biologics for clinical & commercial supply.

With over 20 years of experience producing microbial derived proteins and vaccines, Wacker Biotech is a world-leading partner when it comes to manufacturing microbial biopharmaceuticals.

Wacker Biotech is supporting our customer to scale up the production of a Covid19 vaccine candidate - with an initial plan to produce 100 million doses. We need you to play your part in producing the vaccine!

We are hiring now across our Bioprocessing and Quality teams.


The Supervisor (Covid19 vaccine production) is involved in the supervision, preparation and execution of bulk drug substance of various pharmaceutical products (protein, polysaccharide, live microbial, mRNA).

Your tasks:
Supervision of operators within shift, including appraisals and individual performance mentoringPrepare detailed production schedule and managing execution within a timely mannerAlign shift tasks with supervisor team and managerResponsible for appropriate training status within shift
Responsible for GMP compliance and Safety compliance within shift
Execution of preparative activities for GMP production and GMP production itselfYou are a Subject Matter Expert (SME) with respect to production facility and its equipment and directly involved in maintenance, validation and calibration.

Your profile:
At least an MBO/HBO level of education with relevant technical or biological production experienceQuality and safety-conscious, flexible and proactiveExperience in working under GMP guidelinesTeam player with a high degree of autonomy
Leadership skills on supervisor levelHigh priority on personal hygieneAnalytical, accurate and structured and flexibleWilling to work in shifts (three shifts from Monday to Friday)Good Dutch and English written and oral communicative skillsExperience in the (bio) pharmaceutical IndustryYou reside in and are eligible to work in The Netherlands (valid work permit).
Sustainability is one of WACKER's corporate goals - also as an employer. We want you to remain productive, healthy and successful long term. That is why we offer, for example, comprehensive health management and a variety of advanced training programs and courses for individual development opportunities, alongside a good work-life balance. Naturally, we also have a fair compensation system and above-average social benefits.

For 60 years, Raven has developed, marketed, and produced technical solutions to great challenges. Utilizing our strength in engineering, manufacturing, and technological innovation, Raven today is a leader in precision agriculture, high-performance specialty films, and situational awareness markets. Our purpose to Solve Great Challenges is bold and authentic; it keeps us grounded in markets that have meaning, provide profitable growth, and align with our values.
Raven Applied Technology is dedicated to feeding a growing world population. How would you like to see your creation every time you take a drive through the countryside and know it is putting food on the table? Our technology in precision agriculture drives tractors down the field, wirelessly connects the field and the office, and protects the environment with controlled outputs. Join our team, and help farmers around the world grow more with less.
Raven Europe is hiring an Account Manager to provide sales, technical, and training support to new and existing customers. You will be responsible for seeking out and developing new distribution channels in the Precision Agriculture industry. This position will be based in the Netherlands.


Essential Functions

Manage existing customer relationships. Provide first line of contact for product issues.
Focus on new business development and markets.
Travel to customers regularly.
Provide and/or coordinate sales and technical training on products.
Demonstrate the company’s product line(s) to existing and prospective distributors to solicit sales.
Seek out and develop sales opportunities in an in assigned territory, account, or market.
Prepare price quotes, terms, and delivery dates within guidelines.
Develop product sales plans and lead the implementation of plans.
Aid in the development of new product and product enhancement opportunities.
Provide input for sales forecasting, planning, and goals.
Utilize and maintain a CRM tool.
Represent Raven at trade shows.
Keep Raven informed of competitive and market trends.
Coordinate service and training to Raven customers.
Ensure distributors have sufficient knowledge to market and provide field support for Raven’s products.
Conduct, as appropriate, training sessions/demonstrations of Raven precision products for regional distributors and prospective customers.
Responsible for growing business in an in assigned market/territory or account.
Present the company’s product line to existing and prospective accounts to solicit sales.
Stay current on relevant technology trends.
Prepare various documents and reports as needed.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in business, ag, agronomy, or related field.
Minimum 3 years related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Ability to build and maintain relationships that establish trust and create value.
Sharp perception of verbal and non-verbal communication skills, providing enhancement of sales abilities.
Ability to communicate in clear and professional manner, both verbally and in writing.
Sharp professional presentation skills.
Ability to consider the client, competitors, and Raven to evaluate opportunities.
Proficient with a computer, including Microsoft Office programs.
Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and time management skills.
Team player who is self-motivated, and has ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to communicate effectively with team members and leadership staff.
Ability to travel up to 70% of time, depending on position. Must be able to work variable days and hours as needed.
International positions may require bi-lingual language skills.

About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
We spark joy around mealtime with our iconic brands, including Heinz, Kraft, Bull's-Eye, HP, Lea and Perrins, Quero, ABC, Master, Banquete, Plasmon, Orlando, Benedicta, Honig, Pudliszki, Wattie’s among others.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally . Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy & Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day. As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.
Job Description
About the Position
A lean and continuous improvement mindset is one of the core elements of Kraft Heinz Culture. This position will drive the continuous improvement activities from the Finance team for Manufacturing, Logistics and Procurement in the BU, and provide strategic guidance and input to the Supply Leadership team. This role requires interaction with all business units across the countries and head quarter leadership.
This will be a hands-on role, to build and improve on the existing productivity-reporting infrastructure. It is a great opportunity to define, design and implement the overall productivity business structure across the International Zone (LATAM/EUROPE/ASIA/PACIFIC).
This role is part of the Finance team in close collaboration with business stakeholders and functions like Manufacturing, Logistics, Procurement, R&D, Quality, ORM - supporting their decision-making using analytics and data. Critical to develop and execute strategic Ops programs
Responsibilities include support on reporting, annual planning activities based on specific KPIs, drive improvement projects initiatives, and ensuring the functions deliver short and long-term performance and cost savings.
Support KH improving performance being able to:
Improve, create and build reporting KPIs across the International Zone;
Monitoring, steering and further development of operational KPIs;
Consolidate reports and KPIs measurement from all International BUs;
Ensures quality, accuracy and integrity of information stored in our systems, enabling a single source of truth;
Define financial Gaps and improvement opportunities based on data analysis in the Supply functions;
Define the most appropriated Operational KPIs, connecting financial goals to the shop floor, ensure the indicators are interlinked and the results of them sustain the strategic targets;
Perform actuals and trend analysis in order to pro-actively identify improvements;
Improve information quality to drive leadership strategic decisions;
Business Partnering and stakeholder management: Supply Chain Finance Teams, Supply Heads, Manufacturing, Logistics and Procurement Heads and Operations teams for all Intl business units.
Identify appropriate industry benchmarks, disseminate best practices;
Execute ‘On the Job’ trainings, to promote a learning organization that leverages the Operations Teams to achieve its performance goals;
New area with high potential of growth based on the first-year results

Hard Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics/ Data Technology
Minimum of 3 years of working experience in Finance / Accounting / Supply Chain/ Performance.
Advanced technical skills in Excel, Access, Powerpoint, ERP (SAP preferred), Tableau and Business Data Warehousing tools.
Strong business acumen, interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills.
Motivated self-starter who can effectively work under pressure and manage multiple priorities.

About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
We spark joy around mealtime with our iconic brands, including Heinz, Kraft, Bull's-Eye, HP, Lea and Perrins, Quero, ABC, Master, Banquete, Plasmon, Orlando, Benedicta, Honig, Pudliszki, Wattie’s among others.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally . Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy & Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day. As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.

Job Description
About the Position
A lean and continuous improvement mindset is one of the core elements of Kraft Heinz Culture. This position will drive the continuous improvement activities from the Finance team for Manufacturing, Logistics and Procurement in the BU, and provide strategic guidance and input to the Supply Leadership team. This role requires interaction with all business units across the countries and head quarter leadership.
This will be a hands-on role, to build and improve on the existing productivity-reporting infrastructure. It is a great opportunity to define, design and implement the overall productivity business structure across the International Zone (LATAM/EUROPE/ASIA/PACIFIC).
This role is part of the Finance team in close collaboration with business stakeholders and functions like Manufacturing, Logistics, Procurement, R&D, Quality, ORM - supporting their decision-making using analytics and data. Critical to develop and execute strategic Ops programs
Responsibilities include support on reporting, annual planning activities based on specific KPIs, drive improvement projects initiatives, and ensuring the functions deliver short and long-term performance and cost savings.
Support KH improving performance being able to:
Improve, create and build reporting KPIs across the International Zone;
Monitoring, steering and further development of operational KPIs;
Consolidate reports and KPIs measurement from all International BUs;
Ensures quality, accuracy and integrity of information stored in our systems, enabling a single source of truth;
Define financial Gaps and improvement opportunities based on data analysis in the Supply functions;
Define the most appropriated Operational KPIs, connecting financial goals to the shop floor, ensure the indicators are interlinked and the results of them sustain the strategic targets;
Perform actuals and trend analysis in order to pro-actively identify improvements;
Improve information quality to drive leadership strategic decisions;
Business Partnering and stakeholder management: Supply Chain Finance Teams, Supply Heads, Manufacturing, Logistics and Procurement Heads and Operations teams for all Intl business units.
Identify appropriate industry benchmarks, disseminate best practices;
Execute ‘On the Job’ trainings, to promote a learning organization that leverages the Operations Teams to achieve its performance goals;
New area with high potential of growth based on the first-year results
Qualifications

Hard Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics/ Data Technology
Minimum of 3 years of working experience in Finance / Accounting / Supply Chain/ Performance.
Advanced technical skills in Excel, Access, Powerpoint, ERP (SAP preferred), Tableau and Business Data Warehousing tools.
Strong business acumen, interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills.
Motivated self-starter who can effectively work under pressure and manage multiple priorities.
Possesses the ability to lead teams and effectively work through others. Ability to influence cross-functional team members.
Team player who manages collaboratively with the ability to influence Senior Leaders.
Professional Attributes
Analytical
We’re a very data driven company. You know how to translate complex data into a simple solution with your analytical mindset.
Ability to Simplify
We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated, when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex and high-volume information.
Result driven
You don’t only focus on your own results, but always do what’s right and best for the company.
High pressure
You don’t get easily stressed by pressure, on the opposite, a demanding and dynamic environment is what keeps you energized.
Resilience
You’re able to bounce back after a disappointment or set back, big or small. And always continue to move onward & upward.
Location(s)
Amsterdam

The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
We spark joy around mealtime with our iconic brands, including Heinz, Kraft, Bull's-Eye, HP, Lea and Perrins, Quero, ABC, Master, Banquete, Plasmon, Orlando, Benedicta, Honig, Pudliszki, Wattie’s among others.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally . Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy & Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day. As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.
Job Description
About the Position
A lean and continuous improvement mindset is one of the core elements of Kraft Heinz Culture. This position will drive the continuous improvement activities from the Finance team for Manufacturing, Logistics and Procurement in the BU, and provide strategic guidance and input to the Supply Leadership team. This role requires interaction with all business units across the countries and head quarter leadership.
This will be a hands-on role, to build and improve on the existing productivity-reporting infrastructure. It is a great opportunity to define, design and implement the overall productivity business structure across the International Zone (LATAM/EUROPE/ASIA/PACIFIC).
This role is part of the Finance team in close collaboration with business stakeholders and functions like Manufacturing, Logistics, Procurement, R&D, Quality, ORM - supporting their decision-making using analytics and data. Critical to develop and execute strategic Ops programs
Responsibilities include support on reporting, annual planning activities based on specific KPIs, drive improvement projects initiatives, and ensuring the functions deliver short and long-term performance and cost savings.
Support KH improving performance being able to:
Improve, create and build reporting KPIs across the International Zone;
Monitoring, steering and further development of operational KPIs;
Consolidate reports and KPIs measurement from all International BUs;
Ensures quality, accuracy and integrity of information stored in our systems, enabling a single source of truth;
Define financial Gaps and improvement opportunities based on data analysis in the Supply functions;
Define the most appropriated Operational KPIs, connecting financial goals to the shop floor, ensure the indicators are interlinked and the results of them sustain the strategic targets;
Perform actuals and trend analysis in order to pro-actively identify improvements;
Improve information quality to drive leadership strategic decisions;
Business Partnering and stakeholder management: Supply Chain Finance Teams, Supply Heads, Manufacturing, Logistics and Procurement Heads and Operations teams for all Intl business units.
Identify appropriate industry benchmarks, disseminate best practices;
Execute ‘On the Job’ trainings, to promote a learning organization that leverages the Operations Teams to achieve its performance goals;
New area with high potential of growth based on the first-year results
Qualifications

Hard Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics/ Data Technology
Minimum of 3 years of working experience in Finance / Accounting / Supply Chain/ Performance.
Advanced technical skills in Excel, Access, Powerpoint, ERP (SAP preferred), Tableau and Business Data Warehousing tools.
Strong business acumen, interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills.
Motivated self-starter who can effectively work under pressure and manage multiple priorities.
Possesses the ability to lead teams and effectively work through others. Ability to influence cross-functional team members.
Team player who manages collaboratively with the ability to influence Senior Leaders.
Professional Attributes
Analytical
We’re a very data driven company. You know how to translate complex data into a simple solution with your analytical mindset.
Ability to Simplify
We like to keep it simple. And to execute fast. Your ability to simplify will be highly appreciated, when you provide simple solutions dealing with complex and high-volume information.
Result driven
You don’t only focus on your own results, but always do what’s right and best for the company.
High pressure
You don’t get easily stressed by pressure, on the opposite, a demanding and dynamic environment is what keeps you energized.
Resilience
You’re able to bounce back after a disappointment or set back, big or small. And always continue to move onward & upward.
Location(s)
Amsterdam

QUALIFICATIONS
Professional operations or consulting experience in at least one of the following industry sectors: oil and gas, metals and mining, energy and power generation, chemicals or other process industry, infrastructure, construction and real estate, or manufacturing
Proven track record and expertise in delivering large construction projects (larger than USD 100 million) across the entire project lifecycle (design engineering, risk management, procurement and contracting, construction management, commissioning, ramp-up, etc.)
Advanced graduate degree and excellent academic record required (e.g., Master, MBA, PhD, etc.)
Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Strong record of leadership in an academic, professional, or extracurricular setting
Willing to travel; excited to take on longer international assignments
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You’ll be working with McKinsey’s Operations practice in Europe.
Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.
Our Capital Productivity group is part of our Operations Practice, providing clients with support and advising their management teams on strategic and operational questions relating to large construction projects.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will work in teams of consultants providing managerial expertise gained from large construction projects.
This includes applying your experience in bottom-up design, design optimization, risk management, contracting and procurement, construction management, and the ramp-up of production processes in capital-intensive industries.
You will likely carry out lean construction project implementations and capability building. As part of this, you’ll develop short- and long-term capability-building plans for all relevant levels of client leadership and McKinsey client service teams, with anticipated deliverables, outcomes, and required resources.
You’ll have the opportunity to introduce new frameworks, tools, or ways of using existing material, to identify clients for beta testing, and to codify new knowledge in articles. Colleagues will look to you for your expertise on project/program management tools such as portfolio management, lifecycle planning, and project tracking.
As in with all consultants, you will perform structured, fact-based diagnoses of systems, processes, and organizations across a broad range of industries.
Your application should be in English and include a cover letter, your CV, and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.) indicating all relevant grades.

Your application should be in English and include a cover letter, your CV, and your transcripts (high school, university, etc.) indicating all relevant grades.

QUALIFICATIONS
Professional operations or consulting experience in at least one of the following industry sectors: oil and gas, metals and mining, energy and power generation, chemicals or other process industry, infrastructure, construction and real estate, or manufacturing
Proven track record and expertise in delivering large construction projects (larger than USD 100 million) across the entire project lifecycle (design engineering, risk management, procurement and contracting, construction management, commissioning, ramp-up, etc.)
Advanced graduate degree and excellent academic record required (e.g., Master, MBA, PhD, etc.)
Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
Strong record of leadership in an academic, professional, or extracurricular setting
Willing to travel; excited to take on longer international assignments
Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and local office language
WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You’ll be working with McKinsey’s Operations practice in Europe.
Our Operations practice assists our clients in solving complex operational challenges. Blending strategic thinking with hands-on practicality, our teams of consultants and experts work to develop and implement operational strategies that solve our clients' most critical problems.
Our Capital Productivity group is part of our Operations Practice, providing clients with support and advising their management teams on strategic and operational questions relating to large construction projects.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will work in teams of consultants providing managerial expertise gained from large construction projects.
This includes applying your experience in bottom-up design, design optimization, risk management, contracting and procurement, construction management, and the ramp-up of production processes in capital-intensive industries.
You will likely carry out lean construction project implementations and capability building. As part of this, you’ll develop short- and long-term capability-building plans for all relevant levels of client leadership and McKinsey client service teams, with anticipated deliverables, outcomes, and required resources.
You’ll have the opportunity to introduce new frameworks, tools, or ways of using existing material, to identify clients for beta testing, and to codify new knowledge in articles. Colleagues will look to you for your expertise on project/program management tools such as portfolio management, lifecycle planning, and project tracking.

Would you like to join a fast-growing SaaS startup that is revolutionizing an industry and saving paper at the same time? We are looking for a talented Product Marketer to join Annika & Chris on their mission to drive demand and lead generation here at SwipeGuide. Do you get excited by driving the communication and positioning for features and products? Do you consider yourself to have a growth mindset? Read on....

WHO ARE WE?

We are on a mission to save the world from useless paper instructions. Imagine having to rely upon outdated work instructions that you misplaced whilst working on a busy production line. We realize that PDF and paper instructions are a thing of the past, so we're developing simple, intuitive cloud software to empower factory teams to perform better in their jobs and scale knowledge with digital standard work. Our Swipeguide platform enables global companies like Coca-Cola, Heineken, and PepsiCo to build and share visual step-by-step work instructions with their workforce on any device. We all know that a digital future is unavoidable, and we're providing the software essential for an effective digital transformation. And it's working. We started with five people in 2016, and today, we have twenty-five full-time employees, 100,000+ platform users in 89 countries worldwide, and an inclusive culture that we are always improving.

OUR TEAM OF SWIPEES

We have recently become a part-remote organization, but our office is safe for a small number of people to attend each day (totally optional). For the future, it's totally up to you: hammock on the beach or face-to-face smiles?
We work in a bustling startup hub called B.2 in Amsterdam with 300+ other startups. You'll see the usual ping pong table, foosball, arcade machines and PS4s everywhere. But, there are also lovely places to sit in the sun, break-out areas and ambitious people as far as the eye can see.
You'll soon meet the road cyclist, the yoga lover, the guy with an oyster business, the ex-chef, the person to count on in an emergency, the social butterfly, the basketball player, the green hair dyer and someone who owns hundreds of sneakers.
We like to fail (it's how we learn), and every Thursday in our PowWow, we share our failures and learn together.
Our values are at the heart of everything we do; we strive to enable Swipees to develop their potential and showcase their authentic selves and engage in a culture of inclusion.

YOUR ROLE AS THE PRODUCT MARKETER

As part of the SwipeGuide Growth Circle, as our Product Marketer, you will be expanding the team's breadth and depth of knowledge, particularly in the area of Product Marketing.
Your daily adventures could include:

Drive the communication and positioning for features and products, including selection of channels and audiences.
Craft the messaging for features for the website, sales materials, presentations, social media, emails, support chat and platform banners.
Coordinate with Customer Success, Marketing, and Sales team how customers will be educated about the product/features.
Collaborate on partner marketing activities within budgetary guidelines and deadlines together with partnership lead.
Work with partners to develop joint marketing plans based on integration launches, customer usage, market trends and competitors.
Develop partner marketing tools and ensure that partner programs meet marketing objectives.
ESSENTIAL ATTRIBUTES FOR THE PRODUCT MARKETER

Two years of experience in product marketing /demand generation or similar position, preferably at a SaaS B2B Startup. If you think you could own this function with less experience, we encourage you to apply;
Experience in developing strategies for demand generation, campaign development and lead generation or other commercial positions like sales/customer success/account management
Understanding of positioning/product marketing and (B2B) SaaS features;
Brilliant communication and problem-solving skills;
Able to work independently and make decisions and manage priorities in a fast-paced startup environment;
Organized and structured way-of-working
Fast learner with growth mindset


NICE TO HAVES:

Experience with the technologies we use, including Slack, Hubspot, Asana, Google Suite
Content Marketing experience
Familiar with the Industry4.0 transition; its trends, goals and challenges and how it relates to the manufacturing and machine industry.


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

Unlimited holidays
Remote working opportunities + Amsterdam office
Competitive monthly compensation + monthly holiday pay.
A challenging environment to develop your personal and professional skills with a lot of freedom to take on ownership
You'll be in a fortunate situation to make a high impact at a startup that is about to lift off
You will enjoy working in a startup hub at B. Amsterdam
A chance to learn from other people's mistakes - we share and celebrate failures on Thursday

WHAT ARE YOUR FUTURE COLLEAGUES SAYING ABOUT SWIPEGUIDE?

"I love the atmosphere of collaboration. It really feels like everyone here cares about our product, and genuinely wants it to grow and succeed. That's a healthy kind of place to work." - Chris Content Marketeer

"SwipeGuide gives me hands-on experience in how to build a company from scratch alongside really passionate people. The gap between who I am and who I wanna be as a professional gets smaller every day here, and that's what defines a good workplace for me"
Ingrid (Customer Success Manager)


SwipeGuide is committed to creating a diverse environment influenced by a lifetime of individual experiences. We hire people from all walks of life, not just because it's the right thing to do, but also because when a company is made up of people from diverse backgrounds, the understanding and embracing of their communities grow exponentially. This means our creative and strategic horizons are not only expanding, but being strengthened, thanks to a global perspective. We do not discriminate based on education, race, religion, color, national origin, genetics, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Would you like to join a fast-growing SaaS startup that is revolutionizing an industry and saving paper at the same time? We are looking for a talented Product Marketer to join Annika & Chris on their mission to drive demand and lead generation here at SwipeGuide. Do you get excited by driving the communication and positioning for features and products? Do you consider yourself to have a growth mindset? Read on....

WHO ARE WE?

We are on a mission to save the world from useless paper instructions. Imagine having to rely upon outdated work instructions that you misplaced whilst working on a busy production line. We realize that PDF and paper instructions are a thing of the past, so we're developing simple, intuitive cloud software to empower factory teams to perform better in their jobs and scale knowledge with digital standard work. Our Swipeguide platform enables global companies like Coca-Cola, Heineken, and PepsiCo to build and share visual step-by-step work instructions with their workforce on any device. We all know that a digital future is unavoidable, and we're providing the software essential for an effective digital transformation. And it's working. We started with five people in 2016, and today, we have twenty-five full-time employees, 100,000+ platform users in 89 countries worldwide, and an inclusive culture that we are always improving.

OUR TEAM OF SWIPEES

We have recently become a part-remote organization, but our office is safe for a small number of people to attend each day (totally optional). For the future, it's totally up to you: hammock on the beach or face-to-face smiles?
We work in a bustling startup hub called B.2 in Amsterdam with 300+ other startups. You'll see the usual ping pong table, foosball, arcade machines and PS4s everywhere. But, there are also lovely places to sit in the sun, break-out areas and ambitious people as far as the eye can see.
You'll soon meet the road cyclist, the yoga lover, the guy with an oyster business, the ex-chef, the person to count on in an emergency, the social butterfly, the basketball player, the green hair dyer and someone who owns hundreds of sneakers.
We like to fail (it's how we learn), and every Thursday in our PowWow, we share our failures and learn together.
Our values are at the heart of everything we do; we strive to enable Swipees to develop their potential and showcase their authentic selves and engage in a culture of inclusion.

YOUR ROLE AS THE PRODUCT MARKETER

As part of the SwipeGuide Growth Circle, as our Product Marketer, you will be expanding the team's breadth and depth of knowledge, particularly in the area of Product Marketing.
Your daily adventures could include:

Drive the communication and positioning for features and products, including selection of channels and audiences.
Craft the messaging for features for the website, sales materials, presentations, social media, emails, support chat and platform banners.
Coordinate with Customer Success, Marketing, and Sales team how customers will be educated about the product/features.
Collaborate on partner marketing activities within budgetary guidelines and deadlines together with partnership lead.
Work with partners to develop joint marketing plans based on integration launches, customer usage, market trends and competitors.
Develop partner marketing tools and ensure that partner programs meet marketing objectives.
ESSENTIAL ATTRIBUTES FOR THE PRODUCT MARKETER

Two years of experience in product marketing /demand generation or similar position, preferably at a SaaS B2B Startup. If you think you could own this function with less experience, we encourage you to apply;
Experience in developing strategies for demand generation, campaign development and lead generation or other commercial positions like sales/customer success/account management
Understanding of positioning/product marketing and (B2B) SaaS features;
Brilliant communication and problem-solving skills;
Able to work independently and make decisions and manage priorities in a fast-paced startup environment;
Organized and structured way-of-working
Fast learner with growth mindset


NICE TO HAVES:

Experience with the technologies we use, including Slack, Hubspot, Asana, Google Suite
Content Marketing experience
Familiar with the Industry4.0 transition; its trends, goals and challenges and how it relates to the manufacturing and machine industry.

Would you like to join a fast-growing SaaS startup that is revolutionizing an industry and saving paper at the same time? We are looking for a talented Product Marketer to join Annika & Chris on their mission to drive demand and lead generation here at SwipeGuide. Do you get excited by driving the communication and positioning for features and products? Do you consider yourself to have a growth mindset? Read on....

WHO ARE WE?

We are on a mission to save the world from useless paper instructions. Imagine having to rely upon outdated work instructions that you misplaced whilst working on a busy production line. We realize that PDF and paper instructions are a thing of the past, so we're developing simple, intuitive cloud software to empower factory teams to perform better in their jobs and scale knowledge with digital standard work. Our Swipeguide platform enables global companies like Coca-Cola, Heineken, and PepsiCo to build and share visual step-by-step work instructions with their workforce on any device. We all know that a digital future is unavoidable, and we're providing the software essential for an effective digital transformation. And it's working. We started with five people in 2016, and today, we have twenty-five full-time employees, 100,000+ platform users in 89 countries worldwide, and an inclusive culture that we are always improving.

OUR TEAM OF SWIPEES

We have recently become a part-remote organization, but our office is safe for a small number of people to attend each day (totally optional). For the future, it's totally up to you: hammock on the beach or face-to-face smiles?
We work in a bustling startup hub called B.2 in Amsterdam with 300+ other startups. You'll see the usual ping pong table, foosball, arcade machines and PS4s everywhere. But, there are also lovely places to sit in the sun, break-out areas and ambitious people as far as the eye can see.
You'll soon meet the road cyclist, the yoga lover, the guy with an oyster business, the ex-chef, the person to count on in an emergency, the social butterfly, the basketball player, the green hair dyer and someone who owns hundreds of sneakers.
We like to fail (it's how we learn), and every Thursday in our PowWow, we share our failures and learn together.
Our values are at the heart of everything we do; we strive to enable Swipees to develop their potential and showcase their authentic selves and engage in a culture of inclusion.

YOUR ROLE AS THE PRODUCT MARKETER

As part of the SwipeGuide Growth Circle, as our Product Marketer, you will be expanding the team's breadth and depth of knowledge, particularly in the area of Product Marketing.
Your daily adventures could include:

Drive the communication and positioning for features and products, including selection of channels and audiences.
Craft the messaging for features for the website, sales materials, presentations, social media, emails, support chat and platform banners.
Coordinate with Customer Success, Marketing, and Sales team how customers will be educated about the product/features.
Collaborate on partner marketing activities within budgetary guidelines and deadlines together with partnership lead.
Work with partners to develop joint marketing plans based on integration launches, customer usage, market trends and competitors.
Develop partner marketing tools and ensure that partner programs meet marketing objectives.
ESSENTIAL ATTRIBUTES FOR THE PRODUCT MARKETER

Two years of experience in product marketing /demand generation or similar position, preferably at a SaaS B2B Startup. If you think you could own this function with less experience, we encourage you to apply;
Experience in developing strategies for demand generation, campaign development and lead generation or other commercial positions like sales/customer success/account management
Understanding of positioning/product marketing and (B2B) SaaS features;
Brilliant communication and problem-solving skills;
Able to work independently and make decisions and manage priorities in a fast-paced startup environment;
Organized and structured way-of-working
Fast learner with growth mindset


NICE TO HAVES:

Experience with the technologies we use, including Slack, Hubspot, Asana, Google Suite
Content Marketing experience
Familiar with the Industry4.0 transition; its trends, goals and challenges and how it relates to the manufacturing and machine industry.

Understanding of positioning/product marketing and (B2B) SaaS features;
Brilliant communication and problem-solving skills;
Able to work independently and make decisions and manage priorities in a fast-paced startup environment;
Organized and structured way-of-working
Fast learner with growth mindset


NICE TO HAVES:

Experience with the technologies we use, including Slack, Hubspot, Asana, Google Suite
Content Marketing experience
Familiar with the Industry4.0 transition; its trends, goals and challenges and how it relates to the manufacturing and machine industry.


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

Unlimited holidays
Remote working opportunities + Amsterdam office
Competitive monthly compensation + monthly holiday pay.
A challenging environment to develop your personal and professional skills with a lot of freedom to take on ownership
You'll be in a fortunate situation to make a high impact at a startup that is about to lift off
You will enjoy working in a startup hub at B. Amsterdam
A chance to learn from other people's mistakes - we share and celebrate failures on Thursday

WHAT ARE YOUR FUTURE COLLEAGUES SAYING ABOUT SWIPEGUIDE?

"I love the atmosphere of collaboration. It really feels like everyone here cares about our product, and genuinely wants it to grow and succeed. That's a healthy kind of place to work." - Chris Content Marketeer

"SwipeGuide gives me hands-on experience in how to build a company from scratch alongside really passionate people. The gap between who I am and who I wanna be as a professional gets smaller every day here, and that's what defines a good workplace for me"
Ingrid (Customer Success Manager)


SwipeGuide is committed to creating a diverse environment influenced by a lifetime of individual experiences. We hire people from all walks of life, not just because it's the right thing to do, but also because when a company is made up of people from diverse backgrounds, the understanding and embracing of their communities grow exponentially. This means our creative and strategic horizons are not only expanding, but being strengthened, thanks to a global perspective. We do not discriminate based on education, race, religion, color, national origin, genetics, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Our Client
My client is a financially strong and growing international company that supplies supply chain services with a focus on the commercial, public and telecom sector. By offering service on the highest level, continuous development of employees, being the one stop shop for SME's as well as large multinationals, and offering technology that takes a more and more important place in our society, they experience strong growth for already many years.
Job Description
Ensure that all tasks assigned for the day are completed in a timely manner with quality and accuracy.
Assist in implementation and maintenance of 5S and Lean manufacturing best practices.
Carry out system transactions in Oracle Applications and handscanner.
Learn how to read cabling matrixes and cable computing racks.
Help to maintain necessary inventory of manufacturing supplies (MRO), e.g. latex gloves, cotton swabs, etc.
Repackage and/or de-trash raw material as needed in order to present material to production as appropriate.
Assist with cycle counting of material to ensure inventory integrity.
Assist with the preparation of goods for shipment.
Other tasks as deemed necessary.
Multicultural, financially strong and growing international company
Very socially engaged on global and local level
The Successful Applicant
Minimum of 1 year of experience in warehousing or material handling.
Ability to read fill out material transfer forms.
Must have command of the English language, both written and verbal.
Must be reliable, have good initiative, committed, and quality focused.
Ability to perform repetitious duties while standing for long periods.
Ability to lift 15 kg on a daily basis.
Ability to maintain a safe working environment.
Working in a 2-shift operation is not a problem.
Only candidates living in The Netherlands will be taken into consideration and you need to have a valid work permit.
For this position private transportation (car/scooter/bike) is important.
What's on Offer
19ct per km travel compensation with max 120km per day
25 holidays
Work with very engaged and motivated colleagues
Work for a company with a clear vision and growth opportunities for employees
Daily fresh fruit in the office
Possibility to be converted in company contract with mutual satisfaction after approx 6 months

Work with very engaged and motivated colleagues
Work for a company with a clear vision and growth opportunities for employees
Daily fresh fruit in the office
Possibility to be converted in company contract with mutual satisfaction after approx 6 months

Location: Europe region
Please note: This requisition is an official Cargill talent pool meaning that you might be contacted by a recruiter after applying for this role in case your profile matches our search
Launch your career engaging in meaningful work!
Working at Cargill is an opportunity to thrive – a place to develop your career to the fullest while engaging in meaningful work that makes a positive impact around the globe. Our purpose is to nourish the world in a safe, responsible and sustainable way. Every day, we connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with food. We combine our experience with new technologies and insights to serve as a trusted partner for food, agriculture, financial and industrial customers in more than 125 countries. We offer a diverse, inclusive and inspiring working environment where you will grow personally and professionally.
What is the Technical Management Trainee Program about?
We aim to develop top diverse talent towards future expert and managerial roles for our technical and food science function at Cargill. The program offers access to accelerate development on the job and through other channels during a 24-month program which may include depending on your area of expertise:
Leading or participating in continuous improvement projects in an operations environment, having interaction with finance, maintenance and reliability, manufacturing technology, engineering, safety and quality.
Being responsible for a significant piece of the production process and for the people that make it happen.
Participating actively in the safety and food safety in our operations.
Learning on the job with experts, developing technical and soft skills and receiving coaching from your manager and peers.
Participating in structured learning (digital and instructor led) to develop your technical, professional and leadership skills with peers across Europe, Middle East and Africa, learning from each other during the different sessions of the Cargill European Graduate program.
Building a peer network across Cargill.
What you will bring to Cargill (REQUIRED)
Master or University degree in Engineering (Biochemistry, Chemical, Process, Agricultural, Food Science, or Mechanical).
Entry level work experience (up to 2 years) and/or an internship in relevant areas.
Willingness and flexibility to travel in case required.
Fluency in English and fluency in the local language.
Proven natural leadership ability and excellent interpersonal skills.
Teamwork; ability to work in a multi-cultural and multi-functional teams.
High integrity and ethical standards.
Self-starter; highly motivated and able to work independently. Willingness to take responsibility and initiative. Demonstrated experience in prioritizing work and meeting deadlines.
Fast learner and oriented to self-development: curiosity to learn and create new way of building and/or improving systems and processes.
Strong analytical skills and ability to proactively identify and resolve problems.
Flexibility; able to cope with fast changes within a growing company.
Our Offer
We will provide a fast-paced stimulating international environment, which will challenge and stretch you. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest private companies in the world!
At Cargill, everyone matters and everyone counts. Cargill is committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are treated with dignity and respect. As such and in alignment with our Guiding Principles, Cargill's long-standing equal employment opportunity policy prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant based on race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, marital status, family status, citizenship status, veteran status, military status, union affiliation, or any other status protected by law. Cargill is also aligned with all applicable national and local laws and regulations pertaining to non-discrimination and employment.

Job Title: GLOBAL LOGISTICS OPERATIONS MANAGER - PROCESS EXCELLENCE
Job Description:
Job Details
Location:
Amsterdam, North Holland
Posting date:
26 Nov 2020
Job type:
Permanent
Sector:
Transport & Rail
Salary
£70000 - £75000
Global Logistics Operations Manager - Process Excellence
FTSE 100 Manufacturing Business
Location - Amsterdam, NL or Remote Base + Travel
Salary - €70k-€75k base + Bonus & Benefits
Contact - Rikard, JobsRL@bramwithconsulting.co.uk
Reference: 12597.1

This FTSE 100 organization is looking for a talented logistics project manager to join the growing global logistics team to help drive process improvements and operational efficiency across their logistics operations. This role is in line with a global transformation happening across the business to establish a more centrally managed approach with global strategies being implemented across all regional and local business units.

As the Global Logistics Operations Manager, you will be tasked with re-engineering existing processes to eliminate bottlenecks and identify opportunities to improve efficiency under a new global structure. You will be acting as an internal consultant engaged with several business units and collaborating with a high volume of stakeholders to understand business needs and effectively communicate change strategies.

Among other things, the Global Logistics Operations Manager will be responsible for:-

The creation of process improvement projects within Logistics to be sold to internal stakeholders
Utilization of operations data to identify problem areas and draft effective solutions
Collaborating with Procurement, Supply Chain, and Transformation teams to align on key business goals
Building an extensive network of internal connections and relationships across all business units to access opportunities for idea sharing and value creation
Delivering new initiatives to the global logistics team to maximize efficiency

In order to succeed as the Global Logistics Operations Manager you should have the following skills and prior experience:-

Track record of delivering process improvement projects in a Logistics or Operations department within a multinational organization
Expert knowledge of logistics operations, particularly in inland logistics such as trucking and rail
Excellent communication and stakeholder relationship management skills to build and maintain a complex matrix of internal connections
Exceptional problem solver that can identify problems via efficient analytics and create appropriate solutions to be implemented
Proven ability in project management; capabilities in Lean and Six Sigma are also highly beneficial

This is an opportunity to join a global market leader in a position to truly drive and enact change at a global level. Your projects will have an immediate impact on the global operations of this FTSE 100 organization. If you are a logistics expert looking for your next challenge to deliver operational excellence to a global business, then apply now. Send your CV via the link above or directly to Rikard at JobsRL@bramwithconsulting.co.uk

Introduction:

Join the growing team at DataProphet, an award winning, venture backed manufacturing specialist AI company where, through your success you will be able to have a substantial impact upon the company. Our highly qualified A-team is developing and implementing cutting edge AI value-based solutions which have measurable impact upon our customers in the manufacturing industry.
As recognized by the World Economic Forum and CB Insights in 2020 as one of the Top 100 AI Startups, DataProphet has helped customers around the world, with pre-emptive actions, to reduce their cost of non-quality by an average of 40 percent. We pride ourselves on understanding manufacturing and that real impact is achieved with pre-emptive actions because real-time is often too late.
Role Overview:

We are looking for an ambitious, driven and autonomous sales hunter to fill the role of Head of Growth (Rubber Industry). You will use your entrepreneurial mindset and deep industry knowledge to take full responsibility for initiating contact with potential customers to generate and qualify leads, identify sales opportunities and bring them to close. You must clearly and convincingly articulate the organization’s offerings and value proposition and and drive a sales process based on ROI discussions and value drivers generated through digital transformation.
You will draw from your own network and experience within the Rubber manufacturing sector and make use of strong ROI based sales techniques to sell our guaranteed AI solutions into Manufacturers as well as OEM’s.
Our ideal candidate should be excited about the challenge of hitting and overachieving on their targets supported by clear reporting. You will require previous experience in selling either software or OEM equipment in the Rubber manufacturing sector, be energetic, outgoing, proactive, creative and have attention to detail with outstanding selling and networking skills. Additionally, you should be comfortable with all stages of the sales cycle, both offline and online.
In this role, you will represent our company at a senior level and interact with major clients on a daily basis. Therefore, the successful candidate should possess excellent communication skills, strong commercial acumen and a passion for value based sales in order to achieve success.
Ultimately, you will be measured on achieving both sales and strategic account targets.
Roles and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

Leverage your existing network as well as DataProphet’s networks to locate business opportunities as well as prospect and develop new opportunities outside of your own network.
Build lasting, trusted relationships with customers and partners, identifying the key role players in the organisation and assisting in developing consensus across multiple levels.
Qualify potential deals through engaging with the customer, analyzing deal requirements, and financials with emphasis on developing clear RoI for customers.
Close deals to achieve your individual sales quota by coordinating requirements; developing and negotiating contracts; and integrating contract requirements with business operations.
Enhance DataProphet’s reputation through professional presentation and accepting ownership over role.
Thorough and accurate reporting of deal statuses upon the company’s CRM including forecasting on deals.


Qualifications & Experience:

Approx. 5 years sales experience in Sales including Lead generation and a proven track record of excellence in selling either software or OEM equipment into the Rubber manufacturing sector - both would be advantageous
Strong understanding of manufacturing automation and control as well as the underlying data and integration technologies including common historian, MES, SCADA and PLC products.
Hands on experience with CRM with strong history of accurate reporting
Consistent outperformance of sales performance quotas.
Professional communication and interpersonal skills with an aptitude for building strong client relationships with strong negotiation skills with a problem-solving attitude
Availability to travel as needed with anticipated travel 35% of time in the future.
BSc degree in Sales, Business Administration or relevant technical field for manufacturing


Why join DataProphet?

We are a small but diverse and very ambitious team who are passionate about what we do and aligned in our vision to create inspiring change in the world around us. We spend our days solving challenging technical problems in manufacturing using cutting edge AI.
Our global team works together through the use of technology which is supported by a culture of consistent communication. It is a professional but supportive and fun environment created to provide a space for everyone to bring their best selves to work every day. As a way of connecting and strengthening relationships, when possible, we come together as a team in Cape Town each year for a strategic planning and team building offsite event.
The spirit of curiosity and continuous learning are in our DNA and we encourage everyone to approach all things in this manner so that we continue to grow and develop both as professionals and individuals.
We’re looking for highly skilled, passionate people to help us do something daring, difficult, and incredibly rewarding. If you’re ready to be inspired, solve problems, grow professionally, and unleash your talent…then apply today.

NOTE: This role can be based anywhere in the EU

In this role, you will represent our company at a senior level and interact with major clients on a daily basis. Therefore, the successful candidate should possess excellent communication skills, strong commercial acumen and a passion for value based sales in order to achieve success.
Ultimately, you will be measured on achieving both sales and strategic account targets.
Roles and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

Leverage your existing network as well as DataProphet’s networks to locate business opportunities as well as prospect and develop new opportunities outside of your own network.
Build lasting, trusted relationships with customers and partners, identifying the key role players in the organisation and assisting in developing consensus across multiple levels.
Qualify potential deals through engaging with the customer, analyzing deal requirements, and financials with emphasis on developing clear RoI for customers.
Close deals to achieve your individual sales quota by coordinating requirements; developing and negotiating contracts; and integrating contract requirements with business operations.
Enhance DataProphet’s reputation through professional presentation and accepting ownership over role.
Thorough and accurate reporting of deal statuses upon the company’s CRM including forecasting on deals.


Qualifications & Experience:

Approx. 5 years sales experience in Sales including Lead generation and a proven track record of excellence in selling either software or OEM equipment into the Rubber manufacturing sector - both would be advantageous
Strong understanding of manufacturing automation and control as well as the underlying data and integration technologies including common historian, MES, SCADA and PLC products.
Hands on experience with CRM with strong history of accurate reporting
Consistent outperformance of sales performance quotas.
Professional communication and interpersonal skills with an aptitude for building strong client relationships with strong negotiation skills with a problem-solving attitude
Availability to travel as needed with anticipated travel 35% of time in the future.
BSc degree in Sales, Business Administration or relevant technical field for manufacturing


Why join DataProphet?

We are a small but diverse and very ambitious team who are passionate about what we do and aligned in our vision to create inspiring change in the world around us. We spend our days solving challenging technical problems in manufacturing using cutting edge AI.
Our global team works together through the use of technology which is supported by a culture of consistent communication. It is a professional but supportive and fun environment created to provide a space for everyone to bring their best selves to work every day. As a way of connecting and strengthening relationships, when possible, we come together as a team in Cape Town each year for a strategic planning and team building offsite event.
The spirit of curiosity and continuous learning are in our DNA and we encourage everyone to approach all things in this manner so that we continue to grow and develop both as professionals and individuals.
We’re looking for highly skilled, passionate people to help us do something daring, difficult, and incredibly rewarding. If you’re ready to be inspired, solve problems, grow professionally, and unleash your talent…then apply today.
