Join the growing team at DataProphet, an award winning, venture backed manufacturing specialist AI company where, through your success you will be able to have a substantial impact upon the company. Our highly qualified A-team is developing and implementing cutting edge AI value-based solutions which have measurable impact upon our customers in the manufacturing industry.
As recognized by the World Economic Forum and CB Insights in 2020 as one of the Top 100 AI Startups, DataProphet has helped customers around the world, with pre-emptive actions, to reduce their cost of non-quality by an average of 40 percent. We pride ourselves on understanding manufacturing and that real impact is achieved with pre-emptive actions because real-time is often too late.
Role Overview:

We are looking for an ambitious, driven and autonomous sales hunter to fill the role of Head of Growth (Rubber Industry). You will use your entrepreneurial mindset and deep industry knowledge to take full responsibility for initiating contact with potential customers to generate and qualify leads, identify sales opportunities and bring them to close. You must clearly and convincingly articulate the organization’s offerings and value proposition and and drive a sales process based on ROI discussions and value drivers generated through digital transformation.
You will draw from your own network and experience within the Rubber manufacturing sector and make use of strong ROI based sales techniques to sell our guaranteed AI solutions into Manufacturers as well as OEM’s.
Our ideal candidate should be excited about the challenge of hitting and overachieving on their targets supported by clear reporting. You will require previous experience in selling either software or OEM equipment in the Rubber manufacturing sector, be energetic, outgoing, proactive, creative and have attention to detail with outstanding selling and networking skills. Additionally, you should be comfortable with all stages of the sales cycle, both offline and online.
In this role, you will represent our company at a senior level and interact with major clients on a daily basis. Therefore, the successful candidate should possess excellent communication skills, strong commercial acumen and a passion for value based sales in order to achieve success.
Ultimately, you will be measured on achieving both sales and strategic account targets.
Roles and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

Leverage your existing network as well as DataProphet’s networks to locate business opportunities as well as prospect and develop new opportunities outside of your own network.
Build lasting, trusted relationships with customers and partners, identifying the key role players in the organisation and assisting in developing consensus across multiple levels.
Qualify potential deals through engaging with the customer, analyzing deal requirements, and financials with emphasis on developing clear RoI for customers.
Close deals to achieve your individual sales quota by coordinating requirements; developing and negotiating contracts; and integrating contract requirements with business operations.
Enhance DataProphet’s reputation through professional presentation and accepting ownership over role.
Thorough and accurate reporting of deal statuses upon the company’s CRM including forecasting on deals.


Qualifications & Experience:

Approx. 5 years sales experience in Sales including Lead generation and a proven track record of excellence in selling either software or OEM equipment into the Rubber manufacturing sector - both would be advantageous
Strong understanding of manufacturing automation and control as well as the underlying data and integration technologies including common historian, MES, SCADA and PLC products.
Hands on experience with CRM with strong history of accurate reporting
Consistent outperformance of sales performance quotas.
Professional communication and interpersonal skills with an aptitude for building strong client relationships with strong negotiation skills with a problem-solving attitude
Availability to travel as needed with anticipated travel 35% of time in the future.
BSc degree in Sales, Business Administration or relevant technical field for manufacturing


Why join DataProphet?

We are a small but diverse and very ambitious team who are passionate about what we do and aligned in our vision to create inspiring change in the world around us. We spend our days solving challenging technical problems in manufacturing using cutting edge AI.
Our global team works together through the use of technology which is supported by a culture of consistent communication. It is a professional but supportive and fun environment created to provide a space for everyone to bring their best selves to work every day. As a way of connecting and strengthening relationships, when possible, we come together as a team in Cape Town each year for a strategic planning and team building offsite event.
The spirit of curiosity and continuous learning are in our DNA and we encourage everyone to approach all things in this manner so that we continue to grow and develop both as professionals and individuals.
We’re looking for highly skilled, passionate people to help us do something daring, difficult, and incredibly rewarding. If you’re ready to be inspired, solve problems, grow professionally, and unleash your talent…then apply today.

NOTE: This role can be based anywhere in the EU

Job Title: Country Manager France - Tech Savvy - Home office possible
Job Description: Country Manager France - Tech Savvy - Home office possibleBeetronics designs high quality monitors and touchscreens for professional and industrial use. With a global presence, our display solutions can be found across many applications and industries, including manufacturing, maritime shipping, broadcasting, automotive, healthcare and more, as stand alone monitors or as integrated touchscreens. Typically, our clients find us online first and therefore our business can best be described as Ecommerce.We have already planted a Beetronics flag in the French market, we're now looking for a Country Manager who will be contributing in developing these markets even further. Beetronics is a young and fast growing company, located in Nieuwegein. The head office is just a stone's throw away from the centre of Utrecht.More details: https://www.beetronics.nl/country-manager-franceYour profileWe need someone with excellent written and verbal communication skills in French. The ideal candidate is tech savvy. The nature of our products require basic technical understanding about connectors, resolutions, aspect ratios and voltage ranges.Some key skills and experience we are looking for:· Excellent verbal and written communication in French.· A minimum of 2 years relevant commercial experience· Tech-savvy and highly digital· Able to work highly independent· Experience in online marketing is a plus (Adwords, SEO, Analytics)About the roleYou will be the primary point of contact of Beetronics for the French market. In this role you will be responsible for all incoming acquisition. This can vary from on demand tech support to leading sales cycles from lead to closure. Beyond consulting clients over the phone and email, you will be responsible for optimizing and maintaining the French website and the other French marketing channels. This can range from fine tuning the content, to SEA, SEO, blogs, improving the FAQ and developing use cases.We are growing fast and constantly work to improve our business. Therefore in down time, we need someone who can work independent and is highly motivated to improve the company. We provide the freedom, time and tools to come up with your own projects based on your own interests. In the past this has lead to marketing projects such as developing 3D renders and video content to strategic projects that impact our products and the way we work.Working from the office or from homeYou can work either from home or in our office in Nieuwegein following regular office hours. Our team is always online and we are in direct contact throughout the day via chat, phone, email, project management software and video-conferences.This position requires you to have a dedicated workspace in case you'd like to work from home. A place where you are able to work focused and are able to take calls without distractions during office hours. Beetronics will provide job-specific equipment such as a phone, PC, conference equipment, etc.Apply today!Beetronics offers great benefits based on experience and offers you the opportunity to work from the comfort of your own home. Yet still you will be part of a long established company and work together with colleagues remotely. Within this role, there will be plenty of room for initiative and self-improvement. You will get a big chunk of responsibility and will be part of a young, fast-moving and ambitious team.Eager to learn a lot on the job as well as having enough freedom to start your own projects? We are happy to receive your application. Please, do not forget to include a short letter of motivation.More details: https://www.beetronics.nl/country-manager-franceJob Type: Full-timeSalary: €2,800.00 - €3,500.00 per monthExperience:Commercial or Tech support: 3 years (Preferred)Language:French (Preferred)Work Remotely:Yes

Typically, our clients find us online first and therefore our business can best be described as Ecommerce.We have already planted a Beetronics flag in the French market, we're now looking for a Country Manager who will be contributing in developing these markets even further. Beetronics is a young and fast growing company, located in Nieuwegein. The head office is just a stone's throw away from the centre of Utrecht.More details: https://www.beetronics.nl/country-manager-franceYour profileWe need someone with excellent written and verbal communication skills in French. The ideal candidate is tech savvy. The nature of our products require basic technical understanding about connectors, resolutions, aspect ratios and voltage ranges.Some key skills and experience we are looking for:· Excellent verbal and written communication in French.· A minimum of 2 years relevant commercial experience· Tech-savvy and highly digital· Able to work highly independent· Experience in online marketing is a plus (Adwords, SEO, Analytics)About the roleYou will be the primary point of contact of Beetronics for the French market. In this role you will be responsible for all incoming acquisition. This can vary from on demand tech support to leading sales cycles from lead to closure. Beyond consulting clients over the phone and email, you will be responsible for optimizing and maintaining the French website and the other French marketing channels. This can range from fine tuning the content, to SEA, SEO, blogs, improving the FAQ and developing use cases.We are growing fast and constantly work to improve our business. Therefore in down time, we need someone who can work independent and is highly motivated to improve the company. We provide the freedom, time and tools to come up with your own projects based on your own interests. In the past this has lead to marketing projects such as developing 3D renders and video content to strategic projects that impact our products and the way we work.Working from the office or from homeYou can work either from home or in our office in Nieuwegein following regular office hours. Our team is always online and we are in direct contact throughout the day via chat, phone, email, project management software and video-conferences.This position requires you to have a dedicated workspace in case you'd like to work from home. A place where you are able to work focused and are able to take calls without distractions during office hours. Beetronics will provide job-specific equipment such as a phone, PC, conference equipment, etc.Apply today!Beetronics offers great benefits based on experience and offers you the opportunity to work from the comfort of your own home. Yet still you will be part of a long established company and work together with colleagues remotely. Within this role, there will be plenty of room for initiative and self-improvement. You will get a big chunk of responsibility and will be part of a young, fast-moving and ambitious team.Eager to learn a lot on the job as well as having enough freedom to start your own projects? We are happy to receive your application. Please, do not forget to include a short letter of motivation.More details: https://www.beetronics.nl/country-manager-franceJob Type: Full-timeSalary: €2,800.00 - €3,500.00 per monthExperience:Commercial or Tech support: 3 years (Preferred)Language:French (Preferred)Work Remotely:Yes

Our team is always online and we are in direct contact throughout the day via chat, phone, email, project management software and video-conferences.This position requires you to have a dedicated workspace in case you'd like to work from home. A place where you are able to work focused and are able to take calls without distractions during office hours. Beetronics will provide job-specific equipment such as a phone, PC, conference equipment, etc.Apply today!Beetronics offers great benefits based on experience and offers you the opportunity to work from the comfort of your own home. Yet still you will be part of a long established company and work together with colleagues remotely. Within this role, there will be plenty of room for initiative and self-improvement. You will get a big chunk of responsibility and will be part of a young, fast-moving and ambitious team.Eager to learn a lot on the job as well as having enough freedom to start your own projects? We are happy to receive your application. Job Title: Country Manager France - Tech Savvy - Home office possible
Job Description: Country Manager France - Tech Savvy - Home office possibleBeetronics designs high quality monitors and touchscreens for professional and industrial use. With a global presence, our display solutions can be found across many applications and industries, including manufacturing, maritime shipping, broadcasting, automotive, healthcare and more, as stand alone monitors or as integrated touchscreens. Typically, our clients find us online first and therefore our business can best be described as Ecommerce.We have already planted a Beetronics flag in the French market, we're now looking for a Country Manager who will be contributing in developing these markets even further. Beetronics is a young and fast growing company, located in Nieuwegein. The head office is just a stone's throw away from the centre of Utrecht.More details: https://www.beetronics.nl/country-manager-franceYour profileWe need someone with excellent written and verbal communication skills in French. The ideal candidate is tech savvy. The nature of our products require basic technical understanding about connectors, resolutions, aspect ratios and voltage ranges.Some key skills and experience we are looking for:· Excellent verbal and written communication in French.· A minimum of 2 years relevant commercial experience· Tech-savvy and highly digital· Able to work highly independent· Experience in online marketing is a plus (Adwords, SEO, Analytics)About the roleYou will be the primary point of contact of Beetronics for the French market. In this role you will be responsible for all incoming acquisition. This can vary from on demand tech support to leading sales cycles from lead to closure. Beyond consulting clients over the phone and email, you will be responsible for optimizing and maintaining the French website and the other French marketing channels. This can range from fine tuning the content, to SEA, SEO, blogs, improving the FAQ and developing use cases.We are growing fast and constantly work to improve our business. Therefore in down time, we need someone who can work independent and is highly motivated to improve the company. We provide the freedom, time and tools to come up with your own projects based on your own interests. In the past this has lead to marketing projects such as developing 3D renders and video content to strategic projects that impact our products and the way we work.Working from the office or from homeYou can work either from home or in our office in Nieuwegein following regular office hours. Our team is always online and we are in direct contact throughout the day via chat, phone, email, project management software and video-conferences.This position requires you to have a dedicated workspace in case you'd like to work from home. A place where you are able to work focused and are able to take calls without distractions during office hours. Beetronics will provide job-specific equipment such as a phone, PC, conference equipment, etc.Apply today!Beetronics offers great benefits based on experience and offers you the opportunity to work from the comfort of your own home. Yet still you will be part of a long established company and work together with colleagues remotely. Within this role, there will be plenty of room for initiative and self-improvement. You will get a big chunk of responsibility and will be part of a young, fast-moving and ambitious team.Eager to learn a lot on the job as well as having enough freedom to start your own projects? We are happy to receive your application. We are global leader in industrial process fluids; we continually improve and innovate so our customers can stay ahead in a changing world.

We are currently recruiting for a Buyer, Indirect Spend based in Uithoorn who buyer is responsible for the sourcing & procurement of Indirect spend including services and materials, whilst continuously seeking opportunities for cost improvements, covering all QH facilities in the region and may require some travel to all of these, as well as suppliers’ facilities.

Tasks


Embody our core values: Live safe, act with integrity, embrace diversity, do great things together, exceed customer expectations, drive results.
Develops and implements sourcing strategies for key spend categories including vendor selection, negotiation process and real savings capture.
Owns and manages vendor relationships including vendor performance and compliance with guidelines
Monitors strategy implementation and contract compliance
Tracks performance within each spend category and defines budget impact
For indirect categories where Procurement plays a supporting role (i.e., Tax and Audit, Legal, Professional Services)
Supports/conducts contract negotiation for all managed categories including contract structure, bid process etc
Ensures execution for all POs within managed categories
Ensures compliance with DOA and other internal policies for all managed categories

Requirements


Bachelor’s degree (preferred; or at least three years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Previous manufacturing related purchasing experience, ideally within the chemical sector.
Strong business background, ability to understand customer needs, etc.
Regionally relevant professional procurement certification preferred (e.g.; ISM, CIPS)
Lean Six Sigma/ Continuous Improvement experience preferred
English language skills; written and spoken.

Benefits


Competitive pay programs with excellent opportunities in all geographies, essential to attracting and retaining global talent.
Opportunities to see your efforts contribute toward the success of the business. Solving problems and creating value are part of our DNA.

We are global leader in industrial process fluids; we continually improve and innovate so our customers can stay ahead in a changing world.

We are currently recruiting for a Buyer, Indirect Spend based in Uithoorn who buyer is responsible for the sourcing & procurement of Indirect spend including services and materials, whilst continuously seeking opportunities for cost improvements, covering all QH facilities in the region and may require some travel to all of these, as well as suppliers’ facilities.

Tasks


Embody our core values: Live safe, act with integrity, embrace diversity, do great things together, exceed customer expectations, drive results.
Develops and implements sourcing strategies for key spend categories including vendor selection, negotiation process and real savings capture.
Owns and manages vendor relationships including vendor performance and compliance with guidelines
Monitors strategy implementation and contract compliance
Tracks performance within each spend category and defines budget impact
For indirect categories where Procurement plays a supporting role (i.e., Tax and Audit, Legal, Professional Services)
Supports/conducts contract negotiation for all managed categories including contract structure, bid process etc
Ensures execution for all POs within managed categories
Ensures compliance with DOA and other internal policies for all managed categories

Requirements


Bachelor’s degree (preferred; or at least three years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Previous manufacturing related purchasing experience, ideally within the chemical sector.
Strong business background, ability to understand customer needs, etc.
Regionally relevant professional procurement certification preferred (e.g.; ISM, CIPS)
Lean Six Sigma/ Continuous Improvement experience preferred
English language skills; written and spoken.
